column1: Update Org Details - Process Logic - Enable user to update "Is Delegated?" flag
column31:
As a DSO Account Manager, I want to be able to update the Delegated flag on the "Update Org Details" process, so that we can ensure that Organizations are properly categorized as delegated vs. non-delegated and related providers are credentialed appropriately.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Mock-Up:*

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Add "Delegated" to "Update Org Details" selections*

GIVEN that I am a DSO Account Manager

WHEN I launch the "Update Org Details" process from an Organization account

THEN...
 # I see that below the question "What organization information would you like to change?," there are the following options:
 ## Name
 ## Type, Delegated Status, & Organization Contact Info
 ## Primary Contact
 ## Credentialing and Attestation Contact(s)

 

*Scenario #2: Updating delegated status via UI*

GIVEN that I am a DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the "Update Org Details" process from an Organization account

WHEN I select "Type, Delegated Status, & Organization Contact Info"

THEN...
 # I see that I am permitted to edit the "Is Delegated" field. 
 # I see that the fields appear in the following order:
 ## Row 1: Type, Is Delegated
 ## Row 2: Email, Phone, Fax

 

*Scenario #3: Cascading updates on related records*

GIVEN that I am a DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the "Update Org Details" process from an Organization account

WHEN I select "Type, Delegated Status, & Organization Contact Info"

THEN...
 # If I update the "Is Delegated" flag from unchecked to checked, then I see the following:
 ## TBD
 # If I update the "Is Delegated" flag from checked to unchecked, then I see the following:
 ## TBD

column103:
*Scenario 1{color:#172b4d}: Involuntary Termination Letter is not visible to most users{color}*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed an Ongoing Monitoring case associated with the provider with the decision of "Terminated"

THEN...
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be viewed/downloaded by users with the following profiles:

 # I see that no other users in Salesforce have the ability to view and/or download the Involuntary Termination Letter.

column1: Portal - UI - Hide sensitive document types from Org Managers on cases
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to restrict Organization Managers from viewing denial or termination letters or supporting credentialing details in the Documents component on cases, so that sensitive information is protected and only accessible to authorized personnel.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Denial Letters*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

AND I am viewing any of the following case types via the ProviderDNA portal:
 * Application
 * Appeal associated with an Application
 * Appeal associated with a Credentialing Termination case
 * Appeal associated with a Recredentialing case

WHEN the Dental Director decision associated with the case is “Denied”

THEN…
 # I see that the Denial Letter is hidden.

 

*Scenario #2: Termination Letters*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

AND I am viewing any of the following case types via the ProviderDNA portal:
 * Credentialing Termination
 * Recredentialing

WHEN the Dental Director decision associated with the case is “Denied”

THEN…
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter is hidden.

 

*Scenario #3: Supporting Credentialing Documents*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

WHEN I am viewing any of the following case types via the ProviderDNA portal:
 * Application
 * Credentialing Termination
 * Recredentialing
 * Appeal

THEN…
 # I see that any related Supporting Credentialing Documents are hidden.

column1: DocuSign - Process Logic - Generate DMX Associated Offices Form
column31:
As a Provider, I want to be able to review the Associated Offices Form when adding multiple existing facilities to my application, so that I can expedite joining and expanding my reach in the network.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer to this document for the Template IDs: [DocuSign Template Worklist.xlsx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/Integrations/Docusign/DocuSign%20PDF%20Templates/DocuSign%20Template%20Worklist.xlsx?d=wf6efd8791b34482680c88a6e06d909e0&csf=1&web=1&e=QJ9Dsl]

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*
 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Provider

AND I completed the Portal Application process from an Application case in ProviderDNA

AND the network associated with the application is DMX

AND the application type is any of the following:
 * New Dentist / Existing Location
 * Existing Dentist / Existing Location

WHEN +*more than 3 existing facilities*+ were selected as part of the application

THEN…
 # I see that the Associated Locations form present in the application packet generated via DocuSign is prepopulated with details associated with 3 of the existing facilities. 
 # I see that a separate packet comprised of only an Associated Offices Form is generated via DocuSign and prepopulated with details associated with each additional existing facility.
 # I see that the Associated Offices Form is generated and sent to the Dentist for informational purposes, but a signature is not required.  

 

_Example: An Existing Dentist/Existing Location application is associated with 5 existing facilities — Facility A, Facility B, Facility C, Facility D, and Facility E._ 
 * _The full application packet containing the PSA and Associated Offices Form is prepopulated with details about_ {_}Facility A, Facility B, and Facility C{_}{_}.{_} 
 * _A separate packet containing an Associated Offices Form only is prepopulated with details about Facility D and Facility E._

column1: DocuSign - Process Logic - Generate additional DMX Location Form and W9
column31:
As a Provider, I want to be able to review and sign additional required location forms when adding multiple new facilities, so that I can expedite joining and expanding my reach in the network.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer to this document for the Template IDs: [DocuSign Template Worklist.xlsx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/Integrations/Docusign/DocuSign%20PDF%20Templates/DocuSign%20Template%20Worklist.xlsx?d=wf6efd8791b34482680c88a6e06d909e0&csf=1&web=1&e=QJ9Dsl]

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*
 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Provider

AND I completed the Portal Application process from an Application case in ProviderDNA

AND the network associated with the application is DMX

AND the application type is any of the following:
 * New Dentist / New Location
 * Existing Dentist / New Location / New State
 * Existing Dentist / New Location / Same State

WHEN +*multiple new facilities*+ created as part of the application

THEN…
 # I see that the Location Form and W9 present in the application packet generated via DocuSign is prepopulated with details associated with 1 of the new facilities. 
 # I see that a separate packet comprised of only a Location Form and W9 is generated via DocuSign and prepopulated with details associated with each additional new facility.
 # I see that the Signer that is identified as the Authorized Signer is prompted to sign the following
 ## Location Form (required)
 # I see that the Signer that is identified as the Practice Owner is prompted to sign the following
 ## W-9 (required)

 

_Example: An New Dentist/New Location application is associated with 3 new facilities — Facility A, Facility B, and Facility C._ 
 * _The full application packet containing the prepopulated Credentialing Application, Location Form, Waiver, W9, etc. is prepopulated with details about Facility A._ 
 * _A separate packet containing a Location Form and W9 only is prepopulated with details about Facility B._ 
 * _A separate packet containing a Location Form and W9 only is prepopulated with details about Facility C._

column1: DocuSign - Process Logic - Generate additional DNOA Location Form and W9
column31:
As a Provider, I want to be able to review and sign additional required location forms when adding multiple new facilities, so that I can expedite joining and expanding my reach in the network.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 5
 * SFDC QA: 3

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. For the Portal Application OmniScript, add additional processing logic to send separate Location form packets for any more than 1 new Facilities added. 
2. The DocuSign template setup is pending
3. The template should be called for each new facility that is added except the 1st facility as 1st (or any one) of the facility is already covered as part of the main application packet.
4. Create a new Custom Object: DocuSign Packet Details (DocuSignPacketDetails__c)
- CaseId Lookup to Case object (Application case id)
- Other fields: use the same fields that we introduced to capture EnvelopeId, Status, dates etc. from Case object to this new object
5. Modify the DocuSign batch jobs that are depended on the existing Case object and fields to this new Custom Object DocuSignPacketDetails__c
6. Validate all DocuSign functionalities works as expected including generating separate Location form packets if any

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*
 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Provider

AND I completed the Portal Application process from an Application case in ProviderDNA

AND the network associated with the application is DNOA/Blues

AND the application type is any of the following:
 * New Dentist / New Location
 * Existing Dentist / New Location / New State
 * Existing Dentist / New Location / Same State

WHEN +*multiple new facilities*+ created as part of the application

THEN…
 # I see that the Location Form and W9 present in the application packet generated via DocuSign is prepopulated with details associated with 1 of the new facilities. 
 # I see that a separate packet comprised of only a Location Form and W9 is generated via DocuSign and prepopulated with details associated with each additional new facility.
 # I see that the Signer that is identified as the Authorized Signer is prompted to sign the following
 ## Location Form (required)
 # I see that the Signer that is identified as the Practice Owner is prompted to sign the following
 ## W-9 (required)

 

_Example: A New Dentist/New Location application is associated with 3 new facilities — Facility A, Facility B, and Facility C._ 
 * _The full application packet containing the Credentialing Application, Location Form, Waiver, W9, etc. is prepopulated with details about Facility A._ 
 * _A separate packet containing a Location Form and W9 only is prepopulated with details about Facility B._ 
 * _A separate packet containing a Location Form and W9 only is prepopulated with details about Facility C._

column1: Portal - UX - Implement breadcrumb navigation on launched app process
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to implement a breadcrumb menu, so that users can easily navigate back to their previous views and parent cases.

 

*TASK ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*
 # *Navigation from Application Case:*
 ## When viewing an Application case, the breadcrumb menu should allow the user to navigate back to the “My Applications” table.
 # *Navigation from Recredentialing Case:*
 ## When viewing a Recredentialing case, the breadcrumb menu should allow the user to navigate back to the “My Recredentialing Cases” table.
 # *Navigation from Credentialing Termination Case:*
 ## When viewing a Credentialing case, the breadcrumb menu should allow the user to navigate back to the “My Credentialing Termination Cases” table.
 # *Navigation from Appeal Case:*
 ## If a user opened an Appeal case from a Recredentialing case, the breadcrumb menu should allow the user to navigate back to the parent Recredentialing case.
 ## If a user opened an Appeal case from an Application case, the breadcrumb menu should allow the user to navigate back to the parent Application case.
 ## If a user opened an Appeal case from a Credentialing Termination case, the breadcrumb menu should allow the user to navigate back to the parent Credentialing case.
 ## If a user opened an Appeal case from the “My Appeal Cases” table, the breadcrumb menu should allow the user to navigate back to the “My Appeal Cases” table.

*Additional Notes:*
 * The implementation should be placed in the upper left corner of the page.
 * The breadcrumb menu should dynamically update based on the user's navigation path.
 * The breadcrumb menu should be intuitive and clearly indicate the hierarchy of navigation.

 

Example Breadcrumb Component: [https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/breadcrumbs/|https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/breadcrumbs/__;!!LAlM4g!3V6KxP17KX_twad_eiygAAW38iu1WiE4hsVFChvWfN0knHCNAiU647SJEDz5APf8Hoqqc8443W6MlXVcSoivgeRtrSH2GMJbiA$]

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Build the breadcrumb menu as per AC
2. Validate the component and its display functionality
Note: if any challenges or any deviation to AC bring it to our attention asap

column1: Portal -  UI - Remove additional click to submit comments
column31:
As a Portal user, I want to submit my comment directly by pressing the "Submit Comment" button below the comment box, so that I can save time and avoid the extra step of clicking outside the comment box to submit my comment.

 

Notes: Please review the attached screen recording for reference about the current behavior. In order to submit a comment, the user must first click somewhere outside of the comment box. This is not preferred behavior.

 

+*TASK ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*+

GIVEN that I am a Network Provider or Prospect Provider

AND I am logged into the Provider DNA portal

WHEN I view any of the following case record types:
 * Application
 * Appeal
 * Recredentialing
 * OGM (aka Credentialing Termination) 

THEN...
 # I see that when I enter a value into the Comment box, the "Submit Comment" button becomes clickable.

 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes:*
 *  

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. By default keep the Submit comment button enabled, if no comment entered and user clicks Submit comment, show a error message "TBD"
2. If a comment is entered, it should save the way it is currently
3. Validate the functionality works as expected

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column1: LocationFormOS - Process Logic - Reactivate inactive facility if selected
column31:
As a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager, I want to be able to select existing inactive facilities based on TIN and address, so that I can reactivate the facility and prevent unnecessary duplicates.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):

 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

 

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*
 #  

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Launched from internal app process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the “Provider Application” process from an Application case

AND I launch the “Select Location(s)” subprocess

AND I proceed to create a new Facility or Organization 

AND I click "Next" from the Address Information step

WHEN a matching facility is found with the same Tax ID and Address
 # If the found matching facility is inactive, I see that I am permitted to select "Use Existing Facility."
 # If I select “Use Existing Facility,” I am navigated back to the Location Selections step and the facility is auto-selected in the table.

 

*Scenario #2: Launched from portal app process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the “Portal Application” process from an Application case

AND I launch the “Select Location(s)” subprocess

AND I proceed to create a new Facility or Organization 

AND I click "Next" from the Address Information step

WHEN a matching facility is found with the same Tax ID and Address
 # If the found matching facility is inactive, I see that I am permitted to select "Use Existing Facility."
 # If I select “Use Existing Facility,” I am navigated back to the Location Selections step and the facility is auto-selected in the table.

 

*Scenario #3: Launched from external portal app process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I am viewing a facility associated with an Application case that was moved to "Approved"

WHEN the facility was inactive at the time it was selected in the application

THEN...
 # I see that it is reactivated.
 # I see that the Effective Dates on the facility record are updated per the logic below:
 ## Effective From Date = The Effective From Date associated with the affiliation line
 ## Effective To Date = Cleared to be a blank value
 # I see that all affiliation records that were inactive prior to the facility being reactivated do not change — meaning those affiliations remain inactive.

column1: Portal - UX - Add network disclaimers to recred application
column31:
As a portal user, I want to see relevant disclaimers at the bottom of each page of the recred application, so that I am informed about the relationships between the various networks and Provider DNA.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add the disclaimer content as per AC to the Recred application process based on the Network of the Recred Application
2. Validate the correct disclaimer is shown

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a portal user

WHEN I launch the recred application process from an Application case

THEN…
 # If I am applying to join the DNOA network, then I see the DNOA disclaimer at the bottom the application guided process.
 # If I am applying to join the DMX network, then I see the DMX disclaimer at the bottom the application guided process.
 # If I am applying to join the BCBSIL network, then I see the BCBSIL disclaimer at the bottom the application guided process.
 # If I am applying to join the BCBSOK network, then I see the BCBSOK disclaimer at the bottom the application guided process.
 # If I am applying to join the BCBSTX network, then I see the BCBSTX disclaimer at the bottom the application guided process.
 # If I am applying to join the BCBSMT network, then I see the BCBSMT disclaimer at the bottom the application guided process.
 # If I am applying to join the BCBSNM network, then I see the BCBSNM disclaimer at the bottom the application guided process.

 

+*NETWORK DISCLAIMERS*+

*DNoA:*

_Dental Network of America, LLC is a wholly owned subsidiary of Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company_

 

*BCBSIL: (first disclaimer on top, second below it)*

_Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois, a Division of Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company, an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association_

_Dental Network of America is a separate company that provides dental network administration for Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois_

 

*BCBSMT: (first disclaimer on top, second below it)*

_Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Montana, a Division of Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company, an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association_

_Dental Network of America is a separate company that provides dental network administration for Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Montana_

 __ 

*BCBSNM: (first disclaimer on top, second below it)*

_Blue Cross and Blue Shield of New Mexico, a Division of Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company, an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association_

_Dental Network of America is a separate company that provides dental network administration for Blue Cross and Blue Shield of New Mexico_

 __ 

*BCBSOK: (first disclaimer on top, second below it)*

_Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Oklahoma, a Division of Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company, an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association_

_Dental Network of America is a separate company that provides dental network administration for Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Oklahoma_

 __ 

*BCBSTX: (first disclaimer on top, second below it)*

_Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Texas, a Division of Health Care Service Corporation, a Mutual Legal Reserve Company, an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association_

_Dental Network of America is a separate company that provides dental network administration for Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Texas_

 __ 

*DenteMax:*

_DenteMax, a dental network leasing company, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Dental Network of America, LLC_

column92: 14/Aug/24 6:56 PM;U512507;RE Follow-Up on DSO File Import Process  Effective Dates.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1625340/RE+Follow-Up+on+DSO+File+Import+Process++Effective+Dates.msg
column103:
*Scenario 1: New Healthcare Facility Network records*

GIVEN I am a DSO Account Manager

AND I click the "Submit" button from the "Review Imported Files" process launched from a DSO Account

WHEN I view one of the resulting created affiliation records (aka Healthcare Facility Network records) 

THEN...
 # If the affiliation is associated with DMX:
 ## If I initiated the data load before or on the 15th of the current month, then the Effective From date is the 15th of the current calendar month.
 ## If I initiated the data load after the 15th of the current month, then the  Effective From date is the last day of the current calendar month
 # If the affiliation is associated with DNOA/Blues:
 ## I see that the Effective From date is updated to the same date that I initiated the data load — meaning the same day that I clicked "Submit"

 

*Scenario 2: New Facility Created*

Given I am a DSO Account Manager,

AND I click the "Submit" button from the "Review Imported Files" process launched from a DSO Account

WHEN a new facility is created

THEN...
 # I see that the Effective From date on the Dental Facility matches the Effective From date found on the related affiliation record(s) that were also created as part of the same import.

column1: CredAppOS - Process Logic - Do not commit changes made via Edit Blocks if user exits Portal App process
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to prevent changes made to credential records via tables (aka "Edit Blocks') when the user making the updates exits the "Portal Application" process early, so that we don't save incomplete/inaccurate records to the database. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*
 # Use "ProviderCredentialingApplicationPortalUser" OS, in each of the Edit blocks that we have in each step, any changes (adds, edits, deletes) perform only after the user moves to Next step and do not perform immediately within each Edit block. 
 # Validate all use cases as per AC

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: General Info Step*

GIVEN that I am System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Portal Application" process from an Application case

AND I navigate to the General Info step

AND I respond "yes" to "Have you ever use another name?"

AND I add or update a record through the table components found in the following sections:
 * Other Names

AND I do not click "Next" to advance to the Licenses & Certificates step

WHEN I exit the process by closing the tab or clicking "Cancel" 

THEN...
 # I see that the records I added and/or updated are not committed. 

 

*Scenario #2: Licenses & Certificates Step*

GIVEN that I am System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Portal Application" process from an Application case

AND I navigate to the Licenses & Certificates step

AND I add or update a record through the Edit Block components found in the following sections:
 * Licenses & Certificates
 * Professional Liability Insurance

AND I do not click "Next" to advance to the Education & Board Certification step

WHEN I exit the process by closing the tab or clicking "Cancel" 

THEN...
 # I see that the records I added and/or updated are not committed. 

 

*Scenario #3: Education & Board Certification Step*

GIVEN that I am System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Portal Application" process from an Application case

AND I navigate to the Education & Board Certification step

AND I add or update a record through the table components found in the following sections:
 * Education

AND I do not click "Next" to advance to the Work History step

WHEN I exit the process by closing the tab or clicking "Cancel" 

THEN...
 # I see that the records I added and/or updated are not committed. 

 

*Scenario #4: Work History Step*

GIVEN that I am System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Portal Application" process from an Application case

AND I navigate to the Work History step

AND I add or update a record through the table components found in the following sections:
 * Work History

AND I do not click "Next" to advance to the Professional Questions step

WHEN I exit the process by closing the tab or clicking "Cancel" 

THEN...
 # I see that the records I added and/or updated are not committed.

column1: Comms - Process Logic - Send NM Application-related letters as certified mail
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to ensure that all letters generated via the Salesforce/CCM integration related to the state of New Mexico are sent as certified mail, so that I can comply with regulatory requirements and ensure proper tracking and delivery confirmation for these letters.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Depending on state or letter specific requirements, a letter might need to be sent via the UPS signature process, rather than by standard mail. When constructing the print file name, Salesforce must indicate what method (standard or UPS Signature) should be used to send the letter. This will be controlled via the first element in the print file name. When sending standard, the first element in the print file name should read “DNMPX”. If you are wanting to send the letter via UPS signature, you should instead use “DNMPXC”.

_Standard =_ DNMPX

_UPS Signature =_ DNMPXC

*Print File Name Examples*

+Standard Example+

"DNMPX.TX.DMX-NoReply.1962546150.\{uniqueId}.pdf"

+UPS Signature (Certified) Example+

"DNMPXC.TX.DMX-NoReply.1962546150.\{uniqueId}.pdf"
column92: 23/Aug/24 2:29 PM;U512507;RE Follow-up on demo feedback regarding physical mail.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1634798/RE+Follow-up+on+demo+feedback+regarding+physical+mail.msg
column93: 23/Aug/24 2:29 PM;U512507;RE Follow-up on demo feedback regarding physical mail_v2.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1634799/RE+Follow-up+on+demo+feedback+regarding+physical+mail_v2.msg
column103:
GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

WHEN a provider submits an application related to New Mexico

THEN…
 # I see that the following letter(s) are sent via certified mail:
 ## -Application Acknowledgement Letter-
 ## Credentialing Application Received Letter
 # If the provider’s application required credentialing, then I see that the following letter(s) are sent via certified mail:
 ## Credentialing Application Received Letter
 # If the provider’s application required credentialing AND they were approved, then I see that the following letter(s) are sent via certified mail:
 ## Welcome Letter
 # If the provider’s application required credentialing AND they were denied, then I see that the following letter(s) are sent via certified mail:
 ## Credentialing Denial Letter
 # If the provider’s application did NOT require credentialing AND they were approved, then I see that the following letter(s) are sent via certified mail:
 ## Additional Locations Letter
 # If the provider appeals AND they were denied, then I see that the following letter(s) are sent via certified mail:
 ## Appeal Denial Letter
 # If the provider appeals AND they were approved, then I see that the following letter(s) are sent via certified mail:
 ## Welcome Letter

column1: DSO - Process Logic - Capture load and data errors on staging record
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to capture the errors that are encountered when SFDC attempts to load the staging data into the related objects, so that end users can view and resolve these issues. 

 

*TASK ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*
GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

column1: Cred - Process Logic - Set DMX Effective To date on OGM/recred terms to last day of month
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want the Effective To Date to be automatically set to the same date that the Dental Director terminates a provider, so that I don't have to manually enter the dates and we can appropriately notify the provider of when they are no longer in network. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 6/27/24 "SF PNM: Pre-Refinement | DMX Effective Dates Rules for Cred Scenarios"
 ** Lakeisha Manual
 ** Sharon Dixon 
 * Written Approval(s): 

{color:#0747a6}*___________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes:*
 # If a provider is affiliated with DMX and DNOA in a single state, we will default to setting the Effective To at the Healthcare Provider level to the DNOA logic noted in SFDC-43801. This is the expected/appropriate behavior. Any revisions to setting effective dates at the Healthcare Provider level (if necessary) will be dealt with in a future story. 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer to technical notes on SFDC-43801  for more detail.

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario 1: Dental Director terminates OGM case associated with DOI/Grievance*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I see that the Dental Director closed an OGM case associated with the provider with the decision of "Terminated"

AND the Case Reason associated with the case is Grievances/DOI

AND I navigate to the related provider's account 

AND I see that the provider is in network with DMX

WHEN I view terminated Healthcare Provider and/or Healthcare Facility Network records

THEN...
 # I see that the Effective To date on the related terminated DMX Healthcare Facility Network record(s) is updated per the business rules noted below:
 ## If Dental Director made the decision to terminate the provider BEFORE the last day of the current calendar month, then set the Effective To date to the last day of the current calendar month.  _(See example 1 below.)_
 ## If the Dental Director made the decision to terminate the provider ON the last day of the current calendar month, then set the Effective To date to the last day of the next calendar month.  _(See example 2 below.)_

_{color:#ff0000}Example1:{color} Dental Director makes their decision on 3/10/2024, then the Effective To Date is set to 3/31/2024._
_{color:#ff0000}Example 2:{color} Dental Director makes their decision on 3/31/2024, then the Effective To Date is set to 4/30/2024._

 

*Scenario 2: Dental Director terminates OGM case associated with adverse action*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed an OGM case associated with the provider with the decision of "Terminated"

AND the Case Reason associated with the case is {color:#ff0000}NOT{color} Grievances/DOI

AND I see that the provider is in network with DMX

WHEN I view terminated Healthcare Provider and/or Healthcare Facility Network records

THEN...
 # I see that the Effective To date on the related terminated DMX Healthcare Facility Network record(s) is updated per the business rules noted below:
 ## If Dental Director made the decision to terminate the provider BEFORE the last day of the current calendar month, then set the Effective To date to the last day of the current calendar month.  _(See example 1 below.)_
 ## If the Dental Director made the decision to terminate the provider ON the last day of the current calendar month, then set the Effective To date to the last day of the next calendar month.  _(See example 2 below.)_

_{color:#ff0000}Example1:{color} Dental Director makes their decision on 3/10/2024, then the Effective To Date is set to 3/31/2024._
_{color:#ff0000}Example 2:{color} Dental Director makes their decision on 3/31/2024, then the Effective To Date is set to 4/30/2024._

 

*Scenario 3: Dental Director terminates Recredentialing case*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed a Recredentialing case associated with the provider with the decision of "Terminated"

AND I see that the provider is in network with DMX

WHEN I view terminated Healthcare Provider and/or Healthcare Facility Network records

THEN...
 # I see that the Effective To date on the related terminated DMX Healthcare Facility Network record(s) is updated per the business rules noted below:
 ## If Dental Director made the decision to terminate the provider BEFORE the last day of the current calendar month, then set the Effective To date to the last day of the current calendar month.  _(See example 1 below.)_
 ## If the Dental Director made the decision to terminate the provider ON the last day of the current calendar month, then set the Effective To date to the last day of the next calendar month.  _(See example 2 below.)_

_{color:#ff0000}Example1:{color} Dental Director makes their decision on 3/10/2024, then the Effective To Date is set to 3/31/2024._
_{color:#ff0000}Example 2:{color} Dental Director makes their decision on 3/31/2024, then the Effective To Date is set to 4/30/2024._

column1: Deprioritized to Phase 4 - Change Control - Report & Dashboard Request
column31:
As any user I need to request repots and dashboards from the dental data analytics team so that I can access new or updated reports and dashboards.

 

Solution Overview:

Global Action labeled "Internal Case"

Record type = Internal Case

Owner = Dental Data queue

Subject = [User name] [case reason] Request [Created Date]

Description - Required Field

Create new Case Reason for Internal Case record type only - Reports & Dashboards

If support process doesnt exist for this record type, make one with the values New, In Progress, Closed

New Page Layout for this record type - assigned to all profiles for this record type
 * Case Number
 * Record Type
 * Reason
 * Created By
 * Created Date
 * Owner
 * Subject
 * Description

 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 We will be using standard Case Management for this, and the "Internal Process" record type will be the driver for it.

Create new Case Reason picklist value named "Reports & Dashboards" and assign it to Internal Case record type.
If support process doesnt exist for this record type, make one with the values New, In Progress, Closed.

Create a global action labeled "Internal Case" that should open the page to create a case with the Internal Process record type.
The global action "form" should show the reason (with only the "Reports & Dashboards" value) and description fields required for the user to populate. 
All the rest of the fields described in the Solution Overview should be pre-populated by default (using predefined field values).

The global action should be available for all users when they press the "+" Icon that is on the top right section of the screen in Salesforce.

*Mock-Up:*

 

*Testing Notes:*

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
Given: I am an active user

When: I need to request a new or updated report/dashboard

Then:
 * I can click a button to fill in a form to enter the details of my request
 ** I am required to choose Case Reason and enter a description
 * My request is created as an Internal Case
 * My case is assigned to the Dental Data queue
 * I can view a condensed layout when viewing my internal cases

In actuality, individuals in these positions will be assigned to the same role in Salesforce "Manager, Provider Relations." As a result, you only need to verify that the email is sent to users assigned to the "Manager, Provider Relations" role. 

____________________________________________________________

 * SFDC QA: 1

AND I reviewed the DSO data via the "Review Imported Files" process 

AND I clicked "Submit" from that process to initiate the procedure to load DSO data into the appropriate Salesforce objects

WHEN the entire load procedure is completed

THEN...
 # I receive an email notification with the following details:
 ## Subject Line: Data Load for \{DSO Account Name} complete
 ## Email Body: The recent data load for \{DSO Account Name} is now complete. You can view the import results by viewing the "DSO File Import Result" report on the account here: \{Link to DSO Account}.
 # I see that the email is also sent to the following users above me in the role hierarchy:

column1: Org/Facility Info Change - Process Logic - Do not commit changes made via Edit Blocks if user exits process
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to prevent changes made to credential records via Edit Blocks when the user making the updates exits the "Update Facility Details" and "Update Org Details" process early, so that we don't save incomplete/inaccurate records to the database. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Use UpdateOrgDetailsWorkflow, UpdateFacilityDetailsWorkflow OmniScript to make necessary changes as per AC
2. Validate the functionality works as expected as per AC

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Update Org Details*

GIVEN that I am System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Update Org Details" process from an Organization account

AND I add or update a record through the Edit Block components found in the following selections:
 * Primary Contact
 * Credentialing and Attestation Contact(s)

AND I do not click "Save & Close" to complete the process

WHEN I exit the process by closing the tab or clicking "Cancel"  

THEN...
 # I see that the records I added and/or updated are not committed. 

 

*Scenario #2: Update Facility Details*

GIVEN that I am System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Update Facility Details" process from an Organization account

AND I add or update a record through the Edit Block components found in the following selections:
 * Primary Contact

AND I do not click "Save & Close" to complete the process

WHEN I exit the process by closing the tab or clicking "Cancel"  

THEN...
 # I see that the records I added and/or updated are not committed.

column1: Portal - Action - Initiate self-service action to add locations as Org Manager
column31:
As an Organization, I want to launch a process to add providers associated with my org to new and existing locations in the networks and states where they are already active, so that I can expand their network through a self-service action in ProviderDNA.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Organization Manager

AND I am viewing my home page in the ProviderDNA portal

WHEN I click the “Submit Application” button in the “Connect with More Patients” component

THEN...
 # I am navigated to a new page where I see a table of the providers associated with my Organization account. 
 # I see that the table of providers displays the following attributes:
 ## Select?
 ## Provider Name
 ## NPI
 ## Title
 # I am prompted to complete the following fields and click "Next"
 ## State
 ## Network(s)
 ## TIN
 ## Facility Address
 # After I click "Next," I see that the portal displays a table with the following attributes:
 ## Select?
 ## State
 ## Network
 ## TIN
 ## Facility Address
 ## Network Status
 # I see that if I selected multiple Networks, there are separate rows for each network and provider combination. 
 # I see that the "Select?" column displays checkboxes that default to checked. 
 # I see that the Network Status displays one of the following depending on current affiliations:
 ## If the provider is not NOT already affiliated with the state/network combination, I see the following in the Network Status field:
 ### Add new location in different state. 
 ## If the provider is already affiliated with the state/network combination AND the TIN I entered, I see the following in the Network Status field:
 ### Add new location in same state. 
 ## If the provider already affiliated with the state/network combination, but NOT with the TIN I entered, I see the following message and yes/no question prompt:
 ### Add new location in same state. 
 # I see the following prompt above the table:
 ## Please select the applications that you would like to proceed with. 
 # I see a "Submit" button at the bottom of the page.

column1: Portal - Action - Submit appeal case as Org Manager
column31:
As an Org Manager, I want to be able to initiate the appeal process from Application, Recredentialing, and Credentialing Termination cases, so that I can support providers in joining the network or being reinstated in the network. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*
 # For both Org Manager and Provider users, the "My Appeals" subtab should be:
 ## Renamed "Appeals"
 ## Removed from the "My Account" subtab menu. 
 ## Added to the bottom of the Network Development subtab menu. 
 # The Decision Reason field should be visible to Provider users, but should be hidden to Organization Manager users. 

Refer SFDC-44454
1. This view is only for Org Manager Portal profile users
2. Create a new page for Org Manager to view Appeal cases
3. Create a data table component (similar to the way we display data in Provider 360 view for any of the table) to display Recredentialing Cases (RecordType = Recredentialing ). Show all open Appeal cases that are related to the Organization to which the logged in user is a Contact. 
4. Launch/use OS PNM/ProviderAppealCasePortalUser from the respective scenario's as per AC
5. Validate it works as expected
column103:
*Scenario #1: View list of appeals*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

WHEN I am logged into the Provider DNA portal

THEN...
 # I see that I have visibility into the "Appeals" subtab under the Network Development tab.
 # If I click on the "Appeals" subtab, I am able to see open and closed cases associated with providers affiliated with my Organization account. 

 

*Scenario #2* *Viewing recredentialing case record*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

AND I am viewing a Recredentialing case in the Provider DNA portal

AND the case was closed with the decision of "Terminated"

WHEN there is not an existing related open Appeal case

THEN…
 # I see  “Submit Appeal” CTA button in the upper right corner.
 # I see that if I click the “Submit Appeal” button, the “Portal Appeal” process is launched.
 # When the "Portal Appeal" process is launched, I see that the Decision Reason(s) field is hidden. 

 

*Scenario #3:* *Viewing application case record*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

AND I am viewing an Application case in the Provider DNA portal

AND the case was closed with the decision of "Denied"

WHEN there is not an existing related open Appeal case

THEN…
 # I see  “Submit Appeal” CTA button in the upper right corner.
 # I see that if I click the “Submit Appeal” button, the “Portal Appeal” process is launched.
 # When the "Portal Appeal" process is launched, I see that the Decision Reason(s) field is hidden. 

 

*Scenario #4:* *Viewing credentialing termination case record*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

AND I am viewing a Credentialing Termination case in the Provider DNA portal

AND the case was closed with the decision of "Terminated"

WHEN there is not an existing related open Appeal case

THEN…
 # I see  “Submit Appeal” CTA button in the upper right corner.
 # I see that if I click the “Submit Appeal” button, the “Portal Appeal” process is launched.
 # When the "Portal Appeal" process is launched, I see that the Decision Reason(s) field is hidden.

column1: Portal - Action - Submit recredentialing application as Org Manager
column31:
As an Organization Manager, I want to be able to view Recredentialing cases associated with my organization in the Provider DNA portal, so that I can easily apply on behalf of providers.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 5
 * SFDC QA: 3

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer: SFDC-44452
1. This view is only for Org Manager Portal profile users
2. Create a new page for Org Manager to view Recredentialing cases
3. Create a data table component (similar to the way we display data in Provider 360 view for any of the table) to display Recredentialing Cases (RecordType = Recredentialing ). Show all open Recredentialing cases that are related to the Organization to which the logged in user is a Contact. 
4. Display the fields in the table as per AC (refer SFDC-44452) and readonly mode and no additional action other than link for Case Number
4. On click on Case Number, open the Case detail page (same as what we use for Provider) 
Note: no updates to any data except taking additional actions like adding case comments, uploading document
5. For Recredentialing Case that is not yet Submitted, display "Apply" button and on click launch the "ProviderReCredentialingApplicationPortalUser" OmniScript.
6. Validate the functionality works as expected
column103:
*Scenario #1: View list of cases*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

WHEN I am logged into the Provider DNA portal

THEN...
 # I see that I have visibility into the "Recredentialing" subtab under the Network Development tab.
 # If I click on the "Recredentialing" subtab, I am able to see open and closed cases associated with providers/facilities associated with my Organization account. 

 

*Scenario #2:* *Viewing single case record*

GIVEN that I am an Organization Manager

AND I am viewing a Recredentialing case in the Provider DNA portal

WHEN the case is not closed

THEN…
 # I see an “Apply” CTA button in the upper right corner.
 # I see that if I click the “Apply” button, the “Recred Portal Application” process is launched and I am able to complete the application process on behalf of the provider.

column1: QC - Process Logic - Randomly select Application cases to assign to QC queue
column31:
As a Quality Control (QC) Representative, I want completed Application cases to be randomly selected and assigned to the Quality Control queue at the end of each calendar day, ensuring thorough review of entered application data

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I a QC Rep

THEN…
 # I see that at the end of each calendar day, two Application cases per Provider Data Rep are randomly selected from the holding queue.
 # I see that the selected cases are assigned to the Quality Control queue for review by QC Representatives.
 # I see that if a particular Provider Data Rep completed only 1 or 2 cases by the end of the calendar day, all of their completed cases are assigned to the Quality Control queue.

 

{color:#de350b}*Open Questions:*{color}
 # How many non-Provider Data Rep cases should be assigned daily? Randomly selection of 2 from any DSO Account Manager?
 ## ~20 apps / ~20 changes from non-DE on monthly basis
 ## Configure 1 each / day >>> need QC Manager/Supervisor to be able to configure for both cases routed from DE or non-DE users
 # Reporting requirement:
 ## Cases pulled from non-DE users and results of QC review
 ### Errors & corrected
 ### Errors & outstanding
 ## Accuracy score
 # Should only applications associated with certain scenarios (i.e. New Dentist / Existing Location) be routed to QC? Should scenarios that exclude the credentialing packet not be routed?
 ## No, filtering on app types for DE apps
 ## Confirm with Kary and Jared on non-DE
 ### Do you want to pull paper and eApp?

 

 

Daily Selection:
 * *Non-DE Team:* 2 cases / day
 * *DE:*  2 cases / per user / day

column1: Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Involuntary Termination
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I need the Involuntary Terminations Letter to be automatically sent to the provider when they are terminated via the recredentialing process, so that I do not need to manually generate and send the letter.

 

____________________________________________________________

*Testing Notes*
 # SmartComm Template: INVTERMLTR
 # You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Involuntary Termination (Non-Cred Term Version)|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Involuntary%20Termination%20(Non-Cred%20Term%20Version)?csf=1&web=1&e=Ip74AG]

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 0.5
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):
 * Written Approval(s): RE: [7 of 8] For Review: Recred Involuntary Termination Email & Letter
 ** Monique Sanders-Ellis

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add a configuration record in Settings Manager for INVTERMLTR if it does not already exists
2. SmartComm Template ID: INVTERMLTR
3. You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: Involuntary Termination (Non-Cred Term Version)
4. Mapping Sheet :  [https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAF1315C5-F2E5-4AC3-97F5-46AD3B1410CC%7D&file=Docgen%20Template%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&DefaultItemOpen=1]
5. Trigger this letter generation when for Recredentialing case is terminated (use the Flow automation for Recredentialing Case type)
 - Recordtype = Recredentialing 
 - Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
 - OGMDecision__c = "Terminated"
6. Validate the generated document is correct with the entire content including dynamic data and sent to mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility
7. Validate the document is accessible as per AC only to Devs, Admins, Dental Director and Credentialing Specialist only.

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

WHEN I see that the Dental Director recently closed an recredentialing case associated with the provider with the decision of "Terminated"

THEN...
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility. 
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. name, termination date, termination reason).
 # If the provider is associated with the state of Oklahoma, I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter notes that the provider has 60 days to appeal the decision. 
 # If the provider is not associated with the state of Oklahoma, I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter notes that the provider has 30 days to appeal the decision.

column1: Task Notifications
column31:
As any user I need to be notified when a task I assign to another user is complete so that I can be notified of tasks.

 

Solution Overview:

When task is completed - flow or similar to write chatter message to created by user of task

 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 Create a record triggered flow that will run when a Task is updated. The logic inside the flow should be that if the task's status changed to Completed and the current user is NOT the user that originally created the task, then a chatter post is created "at mentioning" the creator that the task has been completed.
If that's not possible, consider creating a notification as explained here: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.flow_ref_elements_actions_sendcustomnotification.htm&type=5
https://sfdclesson.com/2022/03/10/send-custom-bell-notification-from-flow/

*Mock-Up:*

 

*Testing Notes:*

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
Given: I am an active user

When: I assign a task to another user

Then: I should receive a notification on the platform when that task is complete

column1: DSO - Process Logic - Assign payer participations to new affiliation based on network
column31:
As a DSO Account Manager, I want Salesforce to automatically assign the appropriate subnetworks to affiliations created via the import process, so that the provider is appropriately opted into the appropriate participations. 

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):

 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

1. DSO Add file processing, when Payer Participations records are created
- For Non "Heartland Dental" account, create Payer Participation records based on Network, also consider any opt-outs at facility level should also be reflected.
- For "Heartland Dental" account, refer sub networks from the stage object
2. Validate the import functionality works as expected

 

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Other DSO (not Heartland)* 

GIVEN that I am a DSO Account Manager

AND a new affiliation is created via the DSO file import process

WHEN the affiliation is {color:#ff0000}*NOT*{color} associated with a Heartland Dental facility

THEN...
 # I see that Salesforce creates/assigns the appropriate Payer Participations based on the associated network. 
 # If the new affiliation is associated with an existing Dental Facility that has opted out of a particular Payer Participation, I see that the corresponding new Payer Participation record associated with the provider also automatically reflects that opt out.

 

*Scenario #2: Heartland Dental Only*

GIVEN that I am a DSO Account Manager

AND a new affiliation is created via the DSO file import process

WHEN the affiliation is associated with a Heartland Dental facility

THEN...
 # If the related network is DNOA/Blues, I see that Salesforce creates/assigns the appropriate Payer Participations based on the subnetworks provided by Heartland in the import file. 
 # If the related network is DMX: 
 ## I see that Salesforce creates/assigns the appropriate Payer Participations based on the associated network. 
 ## If the new affiliation is associated with an existing Dental Facility that has opted out of a particular Payer Participation, I see that the corresponding new Payer Participation record associated with the provider also automatically reflects that opt out.

 

***The sub-networks are documented as semi-colon separated and mapped to the Subnetworks__c field on the corresponding STG_DSO_Integration record.

column1: QC - Process Logic - Move Application cases forward that are not randomly selected for QC
column31:
As a Provider Data Representative, I want my Application cases that are not randomly selected for QC to proceed forward to the appropriate step, so that they are actioned/resolved accordingly.  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1:* *Move unselected Application cases forward to credentialing* 

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep

AND I am viewing an Application case that was NOT randomly selected for QC

AND the application falls into any of the following scenarios:
 * New Dentist / New Location
 * New Dentist / Existing Location
 * Existing Dentist / New Location / New State

THEN...
 # I see that the following actions occur:
 ## The Application Case status is updated to "Ready for CVO."
 ## The Application Case Owner is updated to the Credentialing queue. 

 

*Scenario #2:* *Move unselected Application cases forward to closed*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep

AND I am viewing an Application case that was NOT randomly selected for QC

AND the application falls into any of the following scenarios:
 * Existing Dentist / Existing Location
 * Existing Dentist / New Location / Same State / Same Specialty

THEN...
 # I see that the following actions occur:
 ## The Application Case status is updated to "Closed."
 ## The Individual Application related to that case is updated to "Closed."'
 ## The Contract related to that Individual Application is updated to "Approved"

column1: Portal - Action - Initiate self-service action to add locations as Provider
column31:
As a Network Provider, I want to launch a process to add myself to new and existing locations in the networks and states where I am already active, so that I can expand my network through a self-service action in ProviderDNA.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Network Provider

AND I am viewing my home page in the ProviderDNA portal

WHEN I click the “Submit Application” button in the “Connect with More Patients” component

THEN...
 # I am navigated to a new page where I am prompted to complete the following fields and click "Next"
 ## State
 ## Network(s)
 ## TIN
 ## Facility Address
 # After I click "Next," I see that the portal displays a table with the following attributes:
 ## Select?
 ## State
 ## Network
 ## TIN
 ## Facility Address
 ## Network Status
 # I see that if I selected multiple Networks, there are separate rows for each network. 
 # I see that the "Select?" column displays checkboxes that default to checked. 
 # I see that the Network Status displays one of the following depending on my current affiliations:
 ## If I am NOT already affiliated with the state/network combination, I see the following in the Network Status field:
 ### Add new location in different state. 
 ## If I am already affiliated with the state/network combination AND the TIN I entered, I see the following in the Network Status field:
 ### Add new location in same state. 
 ## If I am already affiliated with the state/network combination, but NOT with the TIN I entered, I see the following message and yes/no question prompt:
 ### Add new location in same state. 
 # I see the following prompt above the table:
 ## Please select the applications that you would like to proceed with. 
 # I see a "Submit" button at the bottom of the page.

column1: Provider360 - Process Logic - Update DEA related selections on Update Provider Details
column31:
As an System Admin or Developer, I want to ensure that users are not permitted to add a DEA waiver and DEA certificate in the same state, so that we ensure a high level of data accuracy. 

 

*TASK ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

*Scenario #1: Update Provider Details on Account*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Update Provider Details" process from a Provider account

WHEN I select "DEA Certificate or Waiver" 

THEN...
 # I see that users are not permitted to have an active DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state.
 # If a user attempts to add a DEA certificate or DEA waiver in a state where 1 of those records already exists, I see that they encounter the following error:
 ## Cannot have a DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state. 
 # If a user responds "Yes" to "Is Waived?", I see that the following fields are hidden:
 ## DEA Certificate Number
 ## DEA Expiration Date

 

*Scenario #2: Update Supporting Documents on Appeal/Recred case*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Update Supporting Documents" process from an Appeal/Recred case

WHEN I select "DEA Certificate or Waiver" 

THEN...
 # I see that users are not permitted to have an active DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state.
 # If a user attempts to add a DEA certificate or DEA waiver in a state where 1 of those records already exists, I see that they encounter the following error:
 ## Cannot have a DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state. 
 # If a user responds "Yes" to "Is Waived?", I see that the following fields are hidden:
 ## DEA Certificate Number
 ## DEA Expiration Date

 

*Scenario #3: Application case - internal process*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Provider Application" process from an Application case

AND I navigate to the Licenses, Certificates, and PLI step

WHEN I attempt to create a new "DEA Certificate or Waiver" 

THEN...
 # I see that users are not permitted to have an active DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state.
 # If a user attempts to add a DEA certificate or DEA waiver in a state where 1 of those records already exists, I see that they encounter the following error:
 ## Cannot have a DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state. 
 # If a user responds "Yes" to "Is Waived?", I see that the following fields are hidden:
 ## DEA Certificate Number
 ## State
 ## DEA Expiration Date

 

*Scenario #4: Application case - external process*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Portal Application" process from an Application case

AND I navigate to the Licenses, Certificates, and PLI step

WHEN I attempt to create a new "DEA Certificate or Waiver" 

THEN...
 # I see that users are not permitted to have an active DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state.
 # If a user attempts to add a DEA certificate or DEA waiver in a state where 1 of those records already exists, I see that they encounter the following error:
 ## Cannot have a DEA certificate and DEA waiver in the same state. 
 # If a user responds "Yes" to "Is Waived?", I see that the following fields are hidden:
 ## DEA Certificate Number
 ## State
 ## DEA Expiration Date

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Use UpdateProviderDetailsWorkflow, ManageProviderCredentialWorkflow, ProviderCredentialingApplication & ProviderCredentialingApplicationPortalUser OmniScripts and for "DEA Certificate or Waiver" process or step, enable a validation check to ensure only 1 type of record exists for the same State.
2. Also hide fields based on "Is Waived?" selection as per AC
3. Validate functionality works as expected

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
As a System Admin:
 # I see that an OmniScript exists that allows users to input and edit application details, and that it contains the following steps: 
 ## General Information
 ## Licenses, Certificates & PLI
 ## Education & Board Certification
 ## Work History
 # I see that the OmniScript has been placed on the Application Case Record Page immediately above the Tabs (i.e. Details, Related) component in the main panel. 
 ## The OmniScript's display is configured as "Display button to open OmniScript."
 ## NOTE: This button is a temporary solution to enable near-term testing and configuration. The button will later be removed and replaced with a [FlexCard|https://jira.fyiblue.com/browse/SFDC-37585] that will contain an action that users will use to launch the OmniScript.

column1: DSO - Process Logic - Assign fee schedule to new facility based on organization & zip code
column31:
As a DSO Account Manager, I want Salesforce to automatically assign the appropriate fee schedules to new facilities created via the import process, so that the facility bills correctly based on its geographic location and services offered. 

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):

 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*
1. Create a new BRE "Fee Schedule Assignments" for the data set of "NonHeartland_TD_DefaultFs" sheet with the following fields
DSO Name
ZipCode
-State-
-City-
GP FS
SP FS
Note: for DSO Name field, set "Common" as the value for all rows
 
-2. Add default FS entry- 
-DSO Name = Common-
-ZipCode = NULL-
-State = NULL-
-City = NULL-
-GP Fee Schedule = TBD (confirm with business)-
-SP Fee Schedule = TBD (confirm with business)-
 
3. Create another new BRE "DSO Specific Fee Schedule Assignments" for the data set of "Heartland_TD_DefaultFs" sheet with the following fields
DSO Name
ZipCode
-State-
-City-
Fee Schedule
Note: for DSO Name field, set "Heartland Dental" as the value for all rows. Confirm the DSO account name with business
 
-4. Add default FS entry- 
-DSO Name = Heartland Dental-
-ZipCode = NULL-
-State = NULL-
-City = NULL-
-FS = TBD (confirm with business)-
 
5. Create a new Custom Metadata to configure the "DSOs Specific FS Assignment".
Note: for now only "Heartland Dental" record will be configured. If tomorrow a new DSO wants their own specific FS, then we will add an entry here along with adding records in "DSO Specific Fee Schedule Assignments" BRE.
 
6. Perform the FS assignments in the same order as per AC
i. Check for an active HFN (affiliation) for the same Facility and pick the HealthcareFacilityNetwork.FeeScheduleDefinition__c, if found use this FS for the HFN records that are getting created.
ii. If not found from above, check the DSO name exists in metadata "DSOs Specific FS Assignment"
 - if DSO found use "DSO Specific Fee Schedule Assignments" BRE to fetch FS assignment
 - Input is "Zipcode" value (3 digit or 5 digit based on requirement), output is "Fee Schedule" value
 - -If no record matches, use Default FS record-
 - else use "Fee Schedule Assignments" BRE to fetch FS assignment
 - Input is "Zipcode" value (3 digit or 5 digit based on requirement), output is "GP Fee Schedule" & "SP Fee Schedule" value
 - -If no record matches, use Default FS record-
 - Use "GP Fee Schedule" or "SP Fee Schedule" depending on Specialty
 
7. For the FS, use the FS Salesforce Id
 
8. Use these BRE's, Metadata in the DSO import process for HFN creation and assign the correct FS Id
 
9. Validate the functionality works as expected
 
 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario 1: Existing Facility with Related Fee Schedule*

GIVEN I am a DSO Account Manager

AND I click the "Submit" button from the "Review Imported Files" process launched from a DSO Account

WHEN a newly created affiliation is associated with an existing facility

THEN...
 # If the affiliation is associated with DMX:
 ## The existing active fee schedule associated with the facility is assigned to the new affiliation.
 ## If there are no existing active fee schedules associated with the facility, the fee schedule assigned to the new facility aligns with the facility’s parent DSO and zip code.
 # If the affiliation is associated with DNOA/Blues:
 ## The existing active fee schedule associated with the facility is assigned to the new affiliation.
 ## If there are no existing active fee schedules associated with the facility, the fee schedule assigned to the new facility aligns with the facility’s parent DSO and zip code.

 

*Scenario 2: New Facility Created*

Given I am a DSO Account Manager,

AND I click the "Submit" button from the "Review Imported Files" process launched from a DSO Account

WHEN a new facility is created

THEN...
 # If the facility is associated with DMX:
 ## The fee schedule assigned to the new facility aligns with the facility’s parent DSO and zip code.
 # If the facility is associated with DNOA/Blues:
 ## The fee schedule(s) assigned to the new facility align with the facility’s parent DSO and zip code.

column31:

In actuality, individuals in these positions will be assigned to the same role in Salesforce "Manager, Provider Relations." As a result, you only need to verify that the email is sent to users assigned to the "Manager, Provider Relations" role. 

____________________________________________________________

 * SFDC QA:

GIVEN that I am a DSO Account Manager

WHEN a new file from a DSO is imported into the staging object in Salesforce

THEN...
 # I receive an email notification with the following details:
 ## Subject Line: New \{DSO Account Name} file ready for review

 ## Unit Manager, Provider Relations

_***The DSO Account Name field should be hyperlinked._

column1: Recred - Action - Enable Credentialing Specialist to move case to “Ready for CVO”
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want a “Ready for CVO” button, so that I can indicate that the provider has completed their recredentialing application and it should be incorporated into the CVO’s PSV process.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Approval(s):
 ** Verbal approval on 5/29 from the following individuals:
 *** Lakeisha Manuel
 *** Monique Sanders Ellis 
 *** Kritika Sharma 
 *** Tim Custer
 ** Sent for written approval on 5/23

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

Refer to [Action Button UI.xlsx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Workshop/Action%20Button%20UI.xlsx?d=w0afaa3acb9ca4f569a91910a9bb7d892&csf=1&web=1&e=746oy1] for additional details about visibility requirements. 
 
1. Update "CardProviderActions" FlexCard to include "Ready for CVO" as a button 
Visibility: 
 - Only to "Credentialing Specialist", Developer, Admin profiles and only for ReCred Case record type 
 - Status is any one of these - In Progress, Sent to CVO, Ready for DD Review, Pending
 - Also check for these fields on ReCred case to satisfy
Current dental license received?
Current DEA certificate/waiver received?
Current PLI received?
Current attestation received?
Attestation Complete Date
Note: Rest of buttons from the card should work as expected
2. On click, update the current ReCred Case's Status to "Ready for CVO"
3. Validate the changes works as expected
 
*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column92: 05/Jun/24 5:20 PM;U512507;For Review Sending recredentialing data to CVO.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1560208/For+Review+Sending+recredentialing+data+to+CVO.msg
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an open Recredentialing case

AND the following fields are completed:
 * Current dental license received?
 * Current DEA certificate/waiver received?
 * Current PLI received?
 * Current attestation received?
 * Attestation Complete Date

WHEN the case is in either of the following statuses:
 * New
 * In Progress
 * Sent to CVO
 * Ready for DD Review
 * Pending

THEN…
 # I see a “Ready for CVO” button.
 # I see that when I click the “Ready for CVO” button, the case status moves to “Ready for CVO.”
 # If I was not already the case owner, I see that the case is reassigned to me.
