column93: 02/Jul/24 11:49 PM;U512507;RE For Review Customized requirements for facilities serving tribal members-1.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1583109/RE+For+Review+Customized+requirements+for+facilities+serving+tribal+members-1.msg
column94: 28/Jul/24 9:51 PM;U512507;RE For Review Customized requirements for facilities serving tribal members-2.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1608102/RE+For+Review+Customized+requirements+for+facilities+serving+tribal+members-2.msg
column103:
*Scenario #1: Internal application process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the “Provider Application” process from an Application case

AND I launch the "Select Location(s)" subprocess and proceed to create a new facility

WHEN I navigate to the Dental Office Info step

THEN…
 # I see the checkbox field named "Serves tribal members only?"
 # If I check the box, then I see that I am required to respond yes or no to the "Operates as IHS facility/program?" field.

 

*Scenario #2: External application process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the “Portal Application” process from an Application case

AND I launch the "Select Location(s)" subprocess and proceed to create a new facility

WHEN I navigate to the Dental Office Info step

THEN…
 # I see the checkbox field named "Serves tribal members only?"
 # If I check the box, then I see that I am required to respond yes or no to the "Operates as IHS facility/program?" field.

 

*Scenario #3: Update facility details* 

GIVEN that I am any of the following users:
 * Provider Data Rep
 * DSO Account Manager
 * Network Support Rep

AND I launch the “Update Facility Details" process from a Dental Facility record

WHEN I select "Hours, Accessibilities, Services & Languages"

THEN…
 # I see the checkbox field named "Serves tribal members only?"
 # If I check the box, then I see that I am required to respond yes or no to the "Operates as IHS facility/program?" field.

column1: DSO - Action - Enable user to launch import process from account
column31:
As a DSO Account Manager, I want to have a user interface that can be launched from within Salesforce, so that I can efficiently review and import necessary data. 

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 # For Scenario 2, Point 4 along with File Name, Upload Date, It is expected that attribute Select? will also be visible for user on Uploaded files tab.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):

 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

Please find the mock-up here: [Phase 3 - UI Mock-ups - DSOFileImport_2024-05-28.png|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:i:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/DSO/DSO%20Solution/Phase%203%20-%20UI%20Mock-ups%20-%20DSOFileImport_2024-05-28.png?csf=1&web=1&e=aIUxRz]

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

1. Create a Flexcard (parent) "DSOImportFileProcess"
2. Create a new button "Review Imported Files" on Account object for an Organization Account page layout and launch "DSOImportFileProcess" flexcard created in point 1
Visibility: only to DSO Account Manager, Devs, Admins
RecordType: Business
Type: DSO
(Follow up: if visibility is not possible, we may have to build a new Flexcard for button with right visibility rule and place the Flexcard on page)
3. Create child flexcards for placeholders "DSOImportFileCard" & "DSOImportAddFileCard" for AC 1 & 2 and include in the main card "DSOImportFileProcess".

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Only 1 imported file to review*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I navigate to an Organization account associated with a DSO

WHEN there is only 1 imported file that needs to be reviewed

THEN...
 # I see a button named "Review Imported Files"
 # When I click the button, the process to review and load imported DSO file data is launched in a new console tab. 
 # I see a component that enables me to review the Add data set.
 # Below the component, I see the following buttons:
 ## Cancel
 ## Submit

_*Detailed requirements about the component to view the Add data set are captured in SFDC-44093._

 

*Scenario #2: Multiple imported files to review*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I navigate to an Organization account associated with a DSO

WHEN there are multiple files that need to be reviewed

THEN...
 # I see a button named "Review Imported Files."
 # When I click the button, the process to review and load imported DSO file data is launched in a new console tab. 
 # I see the list of uploaded files associated with the account that have not yet been reviewed and imported in Salesforce. 
 # I see the following attributes about each file:
 ## File Name
 ## Upload Date
 # I see that the oldest file by Upload Date is pre-selected. 
 # I see the following buttons:
 ## Next
 ## Cancel
 # When I click "Next," I see a component that enables me to review the Add data set.
 # Below the component, I see the following buttons:
 ## Cancel
 ## Submit

_*Detailed requirements about the component to view the Add data set are captured in SFDC-44093._

column1: RecredAppOS - Process Logic - Enable provider to report that Board Cert should be removed on Recred App
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want providers to be able to report that their Board Certification should be removed and/or is no longer valid, so that my credentials accurately reflect my current qualifications and status.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*

 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 0.5
 * SFDC QA: 0.5

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Use PNM/ProviderReCredentialingApplicationPortalUser & PNM/ProviderReCredentialingApplication OS, prefill Board Cert data and show the question as per AC.
2. When No is selected, provide an option to capture Expiration data
3. Validate the values are saved properly as per AC

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Internal recred app process*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I launch the “Recred App” process from an open recredentialing case

AND the Board Certification fields pre-populate with existing certification details

WHEN I respond to the question “Become Board Certified or Renewed Certification?” with the answer “No”

THEN…
 # If I was previously board certified, I see that I have the option to enter a Board Certification Expiration Date.

 

*Scenario #2: Portal recred app process*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I launch the “Portal Recred App” process from an open recredentialing case

AND the Board Certification fields pre-populate with existing certification details

WHEN I respond to the question “Become Board Certified or Renewed Certification?” with the answer “No”

THEN…
 # If I was previously board certified, I see that I am required to enter an Expiration Date.

WHEN I navigate to the Licenses, Certificates, and PLI step

THEN…
 # If I create a new State License, I am permitted to select any state.
 # I see that there is not a restriction/rule requiring the license to be from the same state as the location of the facility.

column103:

 # I see the following list views that include open cases owned by the Dental Director queue — filtered by the Case Record Type and Exception Category:

column1: Cred - Process Logic - Enable user to document Expiration Date associated with DEA waiver
column31:
As a Provider Data Rep, I want to update DEA Waiver records in the system by adding an expiration date and implementing a calculation for 6 months validity, so that I can accurately track and manage the expiration status of DEA Waivers for providers.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Internal Provider Application process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep

AND I launch the “Provider Application” process from an Application case

AND I navigate to the License, Certificates, and PLI step

WHEN I create a new DEA Waiver record

THEN…
 # I see and am able to edit the Expiration Date field.
 # Upon entering the expiration date for a DEA Waiver, the system should automatically calculate the date 6 months prior to the Expiration Date.

 

*Scenario #2: External Provider Application process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep

AND I launch the “Portal Application” process from an Application case

WHEN I navigate to the License, Certificates, and PLI step

THEN…
 # If a DEA Certificate or DEA Waiver record associated with the state of the application does NOT already exist:
 # I am permitted to add a new DEA Waiver record.
 # I see and am able to edit the Expiration Date field.
 # Upon entering the expiration date for a DEA Waiver, the system should automatically calculate the date 6 months prior to the Expiration Date.


 # If a DEA Certificate or DEA Waiver record associated with the state of the application already exists AND the Expiration Date is in the past:
 # I am permitted to add a new DEA Waiver record.
 # I see and am able to edit the Expiration Date field.
 # Upon entering the expiration date for a DEA Waiver, the system should automatically calculate the date 6 months prior to the Expiration Date.


 # If a DEA Certificate or DEA Waiver record associated with the state of the application already exists AND the Expiration Date is in the future:
 # I am not permitted to add a new DEA Waiver record.

 

*Scenario #3: Update Provider Details process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep

AND I launch the “Update Provider Details” process from a Provider account

WHEN I create a new DEA Waiver record or edit an existing DEA Waiver record

THEN…
 # I see and am able to edit the Expiration Date field.
 # Upon entering the expiration date for a DEA Waiver, the system should automatically calculate the date 6 months prior to the Expiration Date.

 

*Scenario #4: Update Supporting Documents process*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I launch the “Update Supporting Documents” process from any of the following cases:
 * Appeal
 * Recredentialing

WHEN I create a new DEA Waiver record or edit an existing DEA Waiver record

THEN…
 # I see and am able to edit the Expiration Date field.
 # Upon entering the expiration date for a DEA Waiver, the system should automatically calculate the date 6 months prior to the Expiration Date.

column1: Cred - Process Logic - Select FTCA coverage for providers operating under IHS
column31:
As a Provider Data Rep, DSO Account Manager, or Network Support Rep, I want to be able to select if a provider is covered under the Federal Tort Claims Act, so that we can appropriately document the provider’s coverage when they are operating on an American Indian Reservation through IHS.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 # As the Provider (aka portal user) profile is not created yet in SIT, this functionality will be tested with Provider Data Rep/ Developer profile & will be retested when the user is created in SIT.
 # As the Portal is not created yet, this story will be tested via the Portal Application button on the Provider Application & the Portal will be retested as part of subsequent user stories when ready.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 0.5
 * SFDC QA: 0.5

column93: 05/Jun/24 5:23 PM;U512507;RE For Review Customized requirements for facilities serving tribal members.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1560212/RE+For+Review+Customized+requirements+for+facilities+serving+tribal+members.msg
column103:
*Scenario #1: Internal application process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the “Provider Application” process from an Application case

AND the application is associated with a facility or facilities that operate on an American Indian reservation

AND I navigate to the Licenses, Certificates, and PLI step

WHEN I create a new Insurance Policy record

THEN…
 # At the top of the screen, I see an optional checkbox named “Covered under Federal Tort Claims Act (FTCA)?”
 # If I check this box, I see that all other insurance policy fields (i.e. Current PLI Policy #, Current PLI Carrier) are hidden.
 # If I check this box, I see that the resulting Insurance Policy record is named “FTCA Coverage”

 

*Scenario #2: External application process*

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the “Portal Application” process from an Application case

AND the application is associated with a facility or facilities that operate on an American Indian reservation

AND I navigate to the Licenses, Certificates, and PLI step

WHEN I create a new Insurance Policy record

THEN…
 # At the top of the screen, I see an optional checkbox named “Covered under Federal Tort Claims Act (FTCA)?”
 # If I check this box, I see that all other insurance policy fields (i.e. Current PLI Policy #, Current PLI Carrier) are hidden.
 # If I check this box, I see that the resulting Insurance Policy record is named “FTCA Coverage”

 

*Scenario #3: Update provider details process*

GIVEN that I am any of the following users:
 * Provider Data Rep
 * DSO Account Manager
 * Network Support Rep

AND I launch the “Update Provider Details” from a provider account

AND I select “PLI”

WHEN I create a new Insurance Policy record

THEN…
 # At the top of the screen, I see an optional checkbox named “Covered under Federal Tort Claims Act (FTCA)?”
 # If I check this box, I see that all other insurance policy fields (i.e. Current PLI Policy #, Current PLI Carrier) are hidden.
 # If I check this box, I see that the resulting Insurance Policy record is named “FTCA Coverage”

column1: DSO - Process Logic - Load Add data into the appropriate PNM objects
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want an automated process to load transformed/cleaned "Add" DSO file data into the appropriate PNM objects, so that DSO Account Managers don't have to manually enter data about Adds.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 5
 * SFDC QA: 3

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):

 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

1. Once Submit is clicked after review of Add file data, the selected Load records to be processed and loaded into respective PNM objects and mark these records as Status__c = Complete
2. Any data issues in terms of matching existing records or duplicates to be logged to DataIssues__c
3. Load all PNM objects similar to how we create/update records during application process e.g of objects to be used are
For Application tracking process (Status can be auto Closed) - TBD
 - Case
 - IndividualApplication
 - ApplicationCase
For Provider details:
 - Account (Person Account)
 - Contact (Person Contact)
 - HealthcareProvider
 - PersonName
 - HealthcareProviderNpi
 - HealthcareProviderSpecialty
 - PersonLanguage
 - BusinessLicense
 - InsurancePolicy
 - PersonEducation
 - BoardCertification
 - PersonEmployment
 - Contract
 - HealthcareFacilityNetwork
For Organization / Facility details:
 - Account (Organization)
 - HealthcareFacility (Facility)
 - Contact
 - HealthcareProviderNpi (Organization / Facility)
 - HealthcarePractitionerFacility
 - Location
 - Address
 - AssociatedLocation
 - OperatingHours
 - TimeSlot
4. Validate the entire load process to see the respective records are created/updated

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

WHEN a user clicks the "Submit" button from the "Review Imported Files" process launched from a DSO Account

THEN...
 # I see that the validated data is created and/or updated in the relevant PNM objects (i.e. Dental Facility, Healthcare Facility Network). 
 # I see that the data is mapped to the appropriate fields per the "Add - Data Load Mappings" tab in [DSO File Review - Field Mappings|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/DSO/DSO%20Solution/DSO%20File%20Review%20-%20Field%20Mappings.xlsx?d=w5436b157ba4d40298545513050c17274&csf=1&web=1&e=htjcyc]
 # -I see that any errors encountered as part of the transformation process are logged in an Error Code and Error Message field on the related STG_DSO_Integration__c record.-

column1: DSO - UI - Enable user to view and edit Add data
column31:
As a DSO Account Manager, I want to have a user interface that can be launched from within Salesforce, so that I can validate Addition records loaded into the staging object and also initiate the procedure to load records into relevant PNM objects.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 # AC 1.1 notes that the user should be able to perform horizontal scrolling. This is a remnant of when the expectation was that there would be 50+ columns in the table. Since the business eventually reduced the number of columns to only 10, all columns fit on the screen and there is no need for horizontal scrolling. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):

 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

Please find the mock-up here: [Phase 3 - UI Mock-ups - DSOFileImport_2024-05-28.png|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:i:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/DSO/DSO%20Solution/Phase%203%20-%20UI%20Mock-ups%20-%20DSOFileImport_2024-05-28.png?csf=1&web=1&e=aIUxRz]

*Order the columns based on [DSO File Review- UI - Field Mappings.xlsx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/DSO/DSO%20Solution/DSO%20File%20Review-%20UI%20-%20Field%20Mappings.xlsx?d=w5436b157ba4d40298545513050c17274&csf=1&web=1&e=NMnaaq], not the mock-up

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

Refer SFDC-44590 for the base Flexcards creation
1. Build the "DSOImportFileCard" & "DSOImportAddFileCard" flexcards in details as per requirement / UI AC
2. For "DSOImportFileCard" flexcard
 - Extract data from STG_DSO_Integration__c object for the same DSO account
 - Status__c != Complete
 - DISTINCT of RecordTypeId (Add), FileTracker__c for the same DSO Account
 - ORDER BY CreatedDate DESC
Note: the 1st row will be preselected (no other selections allowed)
3. For "DSOImportAddFileCard" flexcard
 - Extract all data from STG_DSO_Integration__c object for the same DSO account, for the file selected from the previous screen
 - Status__c != Complete
 - ORDER BY StdConfidenceLevel__c DESC
Note: Display 100 records per page (make this as a config setting)
4. All records (line items) will have a checkbox for Load and pre-selected based on Load__c
5. All records (line items) will have a checkbox for Use suggested Physical Address? & pre-selected based on UseStdPhysicalAddress__c
6. On Submit, make updates to records based on selections for Load_{_}c & UseStdPhysicalAddress{_}_c
7. Validate the UI, extraction, display of data, updates are working as expected

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column92: 01/Aug/24 12:20 AM;U512507;RE For Review Delegated DSO File - UI  Notification User Stories.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1611862/RE+For+Review+Delegated+DSO+File+-+UI++Notification+User+Stories.msg
column93: 01/Aug/24 12:24 AM;U512507;RE For Review Delegated DSO File Add File User Stories.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1611864/RE+For+Review+Delegated+DSO+File+Add+File+User+Stories.msg
column103:
GIVEN that I am a DSO Account Manager

WHEN I launch the "Review Imported Files" process from an Organization account

THEN...
 # I am able to preview the uploaded and transformed Address data within Salesforce in a table format.
 ## I am able to scroll -horizontally and- vertically in the table. 
 ## I see that the data is sorted by Suggested Physical Address Confidence % (low to high).
 ## I see that the header row is frozen. 
 ## I see that text is wrapped within the table.
 ## I see that I am able to view 100 records at a time, and that I am able to navigate between multiple pages of data. 
 # I see the columns noted in “UI Table Columns” on the "Add Tab - Mappings" tab in [DSO File Review- UI - Field Mappings.xlsx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/DSO/DSO%20Solution/DSO%20File%20Review-%20UI%20-%20Field%20Mappings.xlsx?d=w5436b157ba4d40298545513050c17274&csf=1&web=1&e=NMnaaq]
 # I see that all fields in the table are read-only except the following:
 ## Load?
 ## Use suggested Physical Address?
 ## Use suggested Billing Address?
 # I see that by default the following boxes are checked, but I am permitted to uncheck them if I want to utilize the originally provided address rather than the suggested address:
 ## Use suggested Physical Address?
 ## Use suggested Billing Address?
 # I see that by default the following boxes are checked, but I am permitted to uncheck them if I do NOT want the associated row of data to be loaded into Salesforce:
 ## Load?

column1: QC - Process Logic - Name facility in Chatter note for clarity
column31:
As a Recruiter or Provider Data Rep utilizing, I want to easily identify which facility is experiencing data issues when multiple facilities are associated with an application, so that I can efficiently address the specific data issues reported by the QC or DE team without the need for manually investigating each individual facility.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):

 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

1. Include Facility Name for all data issues related to a Facility while generating the Chatter Note in both the Send back processes
2. Validate to see it lists properly the Facility Name for the right identified data issues related to a Facility

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Sent back to a recruiter*

GIVEN that I am Recruiter

AND I am viewing an Application case that was sent back to me from a Provider Data Rep due to data issues

AND the application is linked to multiple selected facilities

WHEN the Provider Data Rep indicated that there are data issues with the facility information
 # I see that the Chatter note listing data issues specifies which facility is affected by the reported data issues.
 # If multiple facilities are experiencing data issues, the facility name should be appended to the issues listed in the Chatter note, ensuring clarity and specificity.

 

*Scenario #2: Sent back to a provider data rep*

GIVEN that I am Provider Data Rep

AND I am viewing an Application case that was sent back to me from a QC Rep due to data issues

AND the application is linked to multiple selected facilities

WHEN the QC Rep indicated that there are data issues with the facility information
 # I see that the Chatter note listing data issues specifies which facility is affected by the reported data issues.
 # If multiple facilities are experiencing data issues, the facility name should be appended to the issues listed in the Chatter note, ensuring clarity and specificity.

column1: Recred - Process Logic - Add "In Progress" status
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want to be able to move a Recredentialing case to the "In Progress" status, so that I can differentiate between recredentialing cases associated with providers that submitted their application and I am actively working on, and those that I am still waiting for the provider to submit their recred application details for. 

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 0.5
 * SFDC QA: 0.5

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 4/12/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing - Comms & Appeals"

 * 
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 ** Sharon Dixon
 ** Angela Burns
 * Written Approval(s):

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

Refer to [Action Button UI.xlsx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Workshop/Action%20Button%20UI.xlsx?d=w0afaa3acb9ca4f569a91910a9bb7d892&csf=1&web=1&e=746oy1] for additional details about visibility requirements. 

1. Modify "Recredentialing Case Path" to include "In Progress" after "New"
2. Add a new button "In Progress" and should be visible only to
- Recredentialing record page
- RecordType = Recredentialing 
- Current Status = New
- Profile: Credentialing Specialist, Developer, System Admin
3. On click of "In Progress" button, update the Case.Status to "In Progress"
4. Validate the changes works as expected

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column1: CredAppOS - UI - Only permit the creation of licenses related to the state of the application
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to ensure that we only display license details related to the state of the application and that we only permit users to create licenses associated with the application, so that we mitigate potential confusion by displaying irrelevant records. 

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 # As the Provider (aka portal user) profile is not created yet in SIT, this functionality will be tested with Credentialing Specialist/Developer profile & will be retested when the user is created in SIT.
 # As the Portal is not created yet, this story will be tested via the Portal Application button on the Provider Application & the Portal will be retested as part of subsequent user stories when ready.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 *  

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Use PNM/ProviderCredentialingApplication OS & PNM/ProviderCredentialingApplicationPortalUser OS, on the "Licenses, Certificates & PLI" Step, show only current State (same State of Application) specific licenses/certificates which are Active. 
2. When a new record is created, prefill the State to the same as Application State
3. Validate the data display & prefill for new records works as expected

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1: Internal App Process*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Provider Application" process from an Application case

WHEN I navigate to the "Licenses, Certificates & PLI" step

THEN...
 # If the provider has existing state licenses and/or certificates, then the table in the Licenses & Certificates table only displays:
 ## Active licenses/certificates
 ## Licenses/certificates associated with the same state as the application
 # If I attempt to create a new license/certificate, I see that the State picklist is prefilled/defaulted to the state associated with the application. 

 

*Scenario #2: External App Process*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Portal Application" process from an Application case

WHEN I navigate to the "Licenses, Certificates & PLI" step

THEN...
 # If the provider has existing state licenses and/or certificates, then the table in the Licenses & Certificates table only displays:
 ## Active licenses/certificates
 ## Licenses/certificates associated with the same state as the application
 # If I attempt to create a new license/certificate, I see that the State picklist is prefilled/defaulted to the state associated with the application.

column1: Comms - Email - URAC Term
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I need the URAC Term email to be automatically sent to providers when their application is approved but the provider doesn't meet URAC compliance requirements, so that I do not need to manually generate and send the email.

 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

____________________________________________________________

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 3/25/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing"
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain 

 * 
 **  

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*
 # You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here:  [Email_Accreditation Compliant Network (URAC) Term Letter Template_DenteMax.docx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Accreditation%20Compliant%20Network%20(URAC)%20Term%20Letter%20Template_DenteMax.docx?d=we2287e0bd43643c68c017805bd75856c&csf=1&web=1&e=4Okpyw]

 

*Testing Notes:*
 #  

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario 1: Provider's recred case was approved*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing a Recredentialing case associated with DMX

AND the CVO determined that the provider is NOT eligible for URAC accreditation

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see that the URAC Term email is automatically generated. 
 # I see that the URAC Term email displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. exclusion start date, reason).
 # I see that the URAC Term email is automatically sent to the email documented on the provider account.
 # I see that if the application is associated with DNOA or BCBS, then the sender (aka "From") on the URAC Term email is [recredentialing@dnoa.com|mailto:recredentialing@dnoa.com]. 
 # I see that if the application is associated with DMX, then the sender (aka "From") on the URAC Term email is [recredentialing@dentemax.com|mailto:recredentialing@dentemax.com].

 

*Scenario 2: Provider's appeal was approved*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Appeal Case related to a Recredentialing case associated with DMX

AND the CVO determined that the provider is NOT eligible for URAC accreditation

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's appeal case

THEN...
 # I see that the URAC Term email is automatically generated. 
 # I see that the URAC Term email displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. exclusion start date, reason).
 # I see that the URAC Term email is automatically sent to the email documented on the provider account.
 # I see that if the application is associated with DNOA or BCBS, then the sender (aka "From") on the URAC Term email is [recredentialing@dnoa.com|mailto:recredentialing@dnoa.com]. 
 # I see that if the application is associated with DMX, then the sender (aka "From") on the URAC Term email is [recredentialing@dentemax.com|mailto:recredentialing@dentemax.com].

 

*Scenario 3: URAC Acknowledgement Letter is accessible to all users* 

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND the CVO completed the process of verifying a provider

AND the CVO determined that the provider is NOT eligible for URAC accreditation

AND the provider's application OR appeal was approved

THEN...
 # I see that the URAC Term email is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.

column1: Comms - Email - Recredentialing Success
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I need the Recred Success email to be automatically sent to providers when their recredentialing application is approved, so that I do not need to manually generate and send the email.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*
 * You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Email_Recredentialing Success|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recredentialing%20Success?csf=1&web=1&e=C0cogM]

Refer SFDC-43782 for similar implementation
Refer SFDC-41060, same requirement for Letter

You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: Email_Recredentialing Success
The following fonts should be utilized in the email body:
DMX: Century Gothic
DNOA/Blues: Ariel

1. If these are not configured before, then configure 2 records via Setup -> Organization-Wide Email Addresses
Note: use the test email ids for lower environments, and add a PD step to update the emails for PROD deployment
For DNOA/BCBS
Display Name: DNOAReCredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dnoa.com
Allowed Profiles: All
For DMX
Display Name: DMXReCredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dentemax.com
Allowed Profiles: All

2. Add 2 or 7 new Lightning Email templates (For DNOA/Blues, if we can handle logo's dynamic then 1 template, otherwise 6 templates)
DNOA-Blues Recredentialing Success Email Template
DMX Recredentialing Success Email Template

If we cannot control the logo dynamic for DNOA/BCBSxx, then these are the names for DNOA & Blues
DNOA Recredentialing Success Email Template
BSBCIL Recredentialing Success Email Template
BSBCNM Recredentialing Success Email Template
BSBCTX Recredentialing Success Email Template
BSBCMT Recredentialing Success Email Template
BSBCOK Recredentialing Success Email Template

3. Base object for both these templates is Case

4. Use the content/logo for the template from the above "Email_Recredentialing Success"

5. Use the existing Flow of the actual Email Action that accepts Template Id/Name, Network, any other inputs needed for the Flow
Use this query to fetch the From Email Id based on Input, e.g.
SELECT Id, Address, DisplayName FROM OrgWideEmailAddress WHERE DisplayName='DNOAReCredentialing'

6. Use existing Flow as sub flow with in Recredentialing Case flow and based on the business criteria, call this new Flow
Criteria:
Recordtype = Recredentialing 
Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
OGMDecision__c = "Approved"

7. Validate the emails are working properly based on Network and Types

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario 1: Provider's recredentialing application is approved*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing a recredentialing case

AND the provider is associated with a Standard Office practice

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Success email is automatically generated. 
 # I see that the Recred  Success email displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider:
 ## First Name
 ## Last Name 
 ## Title
 # I see that the Recred  Success email is automatically sent to the email documented on the provider account.
 # I see that if the application is associated with DNOA or BCBS, then the sender (aka "From") on the Recred  Success email is [recredentialing@dnoa.com|mailto:recredentialing@dnoa.com]. 
 # I see that if the application is associated with DMX, then the sender (aka "From") on the Recred Success email is [recredentialing@dentemax.com|mailto:recredentialing@dentemax.com].

 

*Scenario 2: Recred Sucess email is accessible to all users*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I am viewing a recredentialing case

AND the provider is associated with a Standard Office practice

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Success email is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.

column1: Comms - Email - Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want to send a notification to providers about the approval of their recredentialing appeal, specifically for cases without a break in participation, through a "Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Participation" email.

____________________________________________________________

*Testing Notes*
 # You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Email_Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recred%20Appeal%20Approval%20-%20No%20Break%20in%20Coverage?csf=1&web=1&e=GaYgKm]
 # The following fonts should be utilized in the email body:
 ** DMX: Century Gothic
 ** DNOA/Blues: Ariel
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*
Refer SFDC-43782 for similar implementation
Refer SFDC-39099, same requirement for Letter

You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: Email_Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage
The following fonts should be utilized in the email body:
DMX: Century Gothic
DNOA/Blues: Ariel

1. If these are not configured before, then configure 2 records via Setup -> Organization-Wide Email Addresses
Note: use the test email ids for lower environments, and add a PD step to update the emails for PROD deployment
For DNOA/BCBS
Display Name: DNOARecredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dnoa.com
Allowed Profiles: All
For DMX
Display Name: DMXRecredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dentemax.com
Allowed Profiles: All

2. Add 2 or 7 new Lightning Email templates (For DNOA/Blues, it we can handle logo's dynamic then 1 template, otherwise 6 templates)
DNOA-Blues Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template
DMX Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template

If we cannot control the logo dynamic for DNOA/BCBSxx, then these are the names for DNOA & Blues
DNOA Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCIL Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCNM Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCTX Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCMT Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCOK Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Email Template

3. Base object for both these templates is Case

4. Use the content/logo for the template from the above "Email_Appeal Approval Break in Coverage"

5. Use the existing Flow of the actual Email Action that accepts Template Id/Name, Network, any other inputs needed for the Flow
Use this query to fetch the From Email Id based on Input, e.g.
SELECT Id, Address, DisplayName FROM OrgWideEmailAddress WHERE DisplayName='DNOARecredentialing'

6. Use existing Flow as sub flow with in Recredentialing Case flow and based on the business criteria, call this new Flow
Criteria:
Recordtype = Appeal (and its Parent Case's recordtype is Recredentialing)
Type = Recredentialing
Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
The corresponding HFN's Effective to is in FUTURE (IMP/CAUTION: make sure this process runs before clearing the Effective to date on HFNs)

7. Validate the emails are working properly based on Network and Types

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
{*}Scenario 1: P{*}{*}rovider was terminated and reinstated via recredentialing, but there was not a break in coverage - DMX{*}

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Re-credentialing case

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"

AND I see that the Appeal case was approved BEFORE the Effective To date that was previously set on the related Healthcare Facility Network -Provider- record

WHEN the network associated with the affiliation is DMX

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email is automatically generated. 
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider:
 ## First Name
 ## Last Name 
 ## Title
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email is automatically sent to the email documented on the provider account.
 # I see that if the application is associated with DMX, then the sender (aka "From") on the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email is [recredentialing@dentemax.com|mailto:recredentialing@dentemax.com].

 

{*}Scenario 2: P{*}{*}rovider was terminated and reinstated via recredentialing, but there was not a break in coverage - DNOA/BCBS{*}

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Re-credentialing case

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"

WHEN the network associated with the affiliation is DNOA/BCBS

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email is automatically generated. 
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider:
 ## First Name
 ## Last Name 
 ## Title
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email is automatically sent to the email documented on the provider account.
 # I see that if the application is associated with DNOA or BCBS, then the sender (aka "From") on the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email is [recredentialing@dnoa.com|mailto:recredentialing@dnoa.com]. 

 

-*Scenario 2: Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage letter is accessible to all users*-

-GIVEN that I am a System Admin-

-AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Re-credentialing case-

-AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"-

-WHEN I see that the Appeal case was approved BEFORE the Effective To date that was previously set on the related Healthcare Provider record-

-THEN...-
 # -I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage email is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.-

column1: Comms - Email - Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want to send a notification to providers about the approval of their recredentialing appeal, specifically for cases with a break in participation, through a "Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Participation" email.

____________________________________________________________

*Testing Notes*
 # You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Email_Appeal Approval Break in Coverage|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Appeal%20Approval%20Break%20in%20Coverage?csf=1&web=1&e=TDB7na]
 # The following fonts should be utilized in the email body:
 ** DMX: Century Gothic
 ** DNOA/Blues: Ariel
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer SFDC-40704, similar implemented done for email templates
Refer SFDC-39098, same requirement for Letter

You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: Email_Appeal Approval Break in Coverage
The following fonts should be utilized in the email body:
DMX: Century Gothic
DNOA/Blues: Ariel

1. Configure 2 records via Setup -> Organization-Wide Email Addresses
Note: use the test email ids for lower environments, and add a PD step to update the emails for PROD deployment
For DNOA/BCBS
Display Name: DNOARecredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dnoa.com
Allowed Profiles: All
For DMX
Display Name: DMXRecredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dentemax.com
Allowed Profiles: All

2. Add 2 or 7 new Lightning Email templates (For DNOA/Blues, it we can handle logo's dynamic then 1 template, otherwise 6 templates)
DNOA-Blues Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template
DMX Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template

If we cannot control the logo dynamic for DNOA/BCBSxx, then these are the names for DNOA & Blues
DNOA Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCIL Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCNM Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCTX Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCMT Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template
BSBCOK Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Email Template

3. Base object for both these templates is Case

4. Effective Date source is from HFN's Effective Date

5. Use the content/logo for the template from the above "Email_Appeal Approval Break in Coverage"

6. Use the existing Flow of the actual Email Action that accepts Template Id/Name, Network, any other inputs needed for the Flow
Use this query to fetch the From Email Id based on Input, e.g.
SELECT Id, Address, DisplayName FROM OrgWideEmailAddress WHERE DisplayName='DNOARecredentialing'

7. Use existing Flow as sub flow with in Recredentialing Case flow and based on the business criteria, call this new Flow
Criteria:
Recordtype = Appeal (and its Parent Case's recordtype is Recredentialing)
Type = Recredentialing
Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
The corresponding HFN's Effective to is in PAST (IMP/CAUTION: make sure this process runs before creating a new set of HFN's and refer the old set of records)

8. Validate the emails are working properly based on Network and Types

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column1: RecredAppOS - UI - Allow user to upload Other Supporting Documents
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist,  I want the ability to upload "Other Supporting Documents" to my recredentialing application, so that I can attach any supplementary materials (i.e. malpractice suit details) to support my responses to the Professional Questions.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 # As the Provider (aka portal user) profile is not created yet in SIT, this functionality will be tested with Credentialing Specialist/Developer profile & will be retested when the user is created in SIT.
 # As the Portal is not created yet, this story will be tested via the Portal Application button on the Provider Application & the Portal will be retested as part of subsequent user stories when ready.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 0.5
 * SFDC QA: 0.5

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 3/18/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing"
 ** Kritika Sharma (first 30 min)
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain [11 of 11] For Review: Allow user to upload supporting documents
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add new picklist value to Category_{_}c as "Add Other" & Document_Type{_}_c as "Supporting Credentialing Documents" as dependent value in Identifier object
2. Use PNM/ProviderReCredentialingApplicationPortalUser & PNM/ProviderReCredentialingApplication OS, on the Attachment Step, enable/add "Other Supporting Documents" as a new option to select
3. Validate the values are saved properly as per AC

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column1: Info Change - Process Logic - Update Healthcare Provider names when parent Account name changes
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to update the name of the Healthcare Provider record when its parent provider Account name changes, so that we can keep these records in sync and eliminate the potential for confusion.

 

*TASK ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Update Provider Details" process from a Provider account

AND I select "Name"

AND I change the name and complete the process

WHEN I view the Healthcare Provider related to the Provider account

THEN...
 #  I see that the Healthcare Provider name reflects the change I made to the parent Account name.  

 

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

____________________________________________________________

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
As a System Admin:
 # I see that an OmniScript exists that allows users to input and edit application details, and that it contains the following steps: 
 ## General Information
 ## Licenses, Certificates & PLI
 ## Education & Board Certification
 ## Work History
 # I see that the OmniScript has been placed on the Application Case Record Page immediately above the Tabs (i.e. Details, Related) component in the main panel.

column1: Update Supporting Docs - Process Logic - Do not commit changes made via Edit Blocks if user exits process
column31:
As a System Admin or Developer, I want to prevent changes made to credential records via tables (aka "Edit Blocks") when the user making the updates exits the "Update Supporting Documents" process early, so that we don't save incomplete/inaccurate records to the database. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Use ""Update Supporting Documents" OS, in each of the Edit blocks that we have, any changes (adds, edits, deletes) perform only after the user moves to Next step or Save & Close and do not perform immediately within each Edit block.
2. Validate all use cases as per AC

 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
GIVEN that I am System Admin or Developer

AND I launch the "Update Supporting Documents process from an Appeal or Recredentialing case

AND I add or update any of the following records:
 * BNDD Certificate
 * CDS Certificate
 * DEA Certificate or Waiver
 * PLI
 * State License

AND I do not click "Save & Close" to complete the process

WHEN I exit the process by closing the tab or clicking "Cancel"  

THEN...
 # I see that the records I added and/or updated are not committed.

column1: CredAppOS - Process Logic - Adjust CAQH ID validation logic
column31:

GIVEN that I am a Provider Data Rep or DSO Account Manager

AND I am viewing an open Application case

AND I launch the "Provider Application" process

WHEN I navigate to the General Info step

THEN...
 # If I enter a value into the CAQH ID field, I see that am required to enter the complete 8 alphanumeric ID in order to proceed to the next step in the process. 
 # If I leave the CAQH ID field blank, I see that I am able to proceed to the next step without entering a value into the field.
 # If I enter a value into the CAQH ID field and then delete/clear it, I see that I am able to proceed to the next step without entering a value into the field.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

column1: Info Change - UI - Allow user to update Specialty via "Update Provider Details" process
column31:
As a Provider Data Rep, Network Support Rep, or DSO Account Manager, I want to be able to change a provider's specialty via the "Update Provider Details" process, so that all key changes to a provider's information are initiated the same way. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario: Launching update provider details*

GIVEN that I am a user with any of the following profiles:
 * Provider Data Rep (i.e. enrollment, data entry)
 * Network Support Rep
 * DSO Account Manager

AND I am viewing a Provider account

WHEN I launch the "Update Provider Details" process

THEN...
 # I see that am able to select "Specialty."
 # I see that the "Specialty" selection appears below "Provider Selections" and above "State License.

 

*Scenario #2: Initiating a specialty change*

GIVEN that I am a user with any of the following profiles:
 * Provider Data Rep (i.e. enrollment, data entry)
 * Network Support Rep
 * DSO Account Manager

AND I am viewing a Provider account

AND I launch the "Update Provider Details" process

WHEN I select "Specialty"

THEN...
 # I see that I am required to select the provider's existing license in the state where they are changing their specialty.
 # I see that I am able to take the following actions to add and/or update license changes as needed:
 ## Edit the following details associated with the existing state license:
 ### Expiration Date
 ## Add a new state license with the following details:
 ### License Number
 ### Expiration Date
 # If I create a new license, I see that the associated State defaults to the same state as the existing license I selected.
 # I see that I am able to select if the provider is associated with a Delegated DSO. 
 # I see that I am able to select if the provider is board certified and, if so, enter their board certification details.
 # I see that I am able to upload the following types of required documentation:
 ## State License
 ## Specialty Certificate
 ## Written Correspondence

 

*Scenario #3: Provider specialty change does NOT require credentialing*

GIVEN that I am a user with any of the following profiles:
 * Provider Data Rep (i.e. enrollment, data entry)
 * Network Support Rep
 * DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the "Update Provider Details" process to change the provider's Specialty

AND the provider is NOT associated with a Delegated DSO

AND I upload a Specialty Certificate

WHEN I click "Submit"

THEN...
 # If the Board Certification fields are left blank, I see that the following actions occur:
 ## The Case Owner is updated to my name. 
 ## The Case Status is updated to "Closed."
 ## The Decision field on the case is updated to "Approved."
 ## The selected Business License and new specialty are captured on the case. 
 # If the Board Certification fields are NOT left blank, I see that the following actions occur:
 ## The Case Status is updated to "In Progress."
 ## The Case Owner is updated to "Credentialing" queue. 
 ## The selected Business License, new specialty, and Board Certification details are captured on the case. 

 

*Scenario #4: Provider specialty change requires credentialing*

GIVEN that I am a user with any of the following profiles:
 * Provider Data Rep (i.e. enrollment, data entry)
 * Network Support Rep
 * DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the "Update Provider Details" process to change the provider's Specialty

AND the provider is NOT associated with a Delegated DSO

AND I do NOT upload a Specialty Certificate

WHEN I click "Submit"

THEN...
 # I see that the following actions occur:
 ## The Case Status is updated to "In Progress."
 ## The Case Owner is updated to "Credentialing" queue. 
 ## The selected Business License, new specialty, and (if relevant) Board Certification details are captured on the case. 

 

*Scenario #5: Delegated DSO provider specialty change does NOT require credentialing*

GIVEN that I am a user with any of the following profiles:
 * Provider Data Rep (i.e. enrollment, data entry)
 * Network Support Rep
 * DSO Account Manager

AND I launch the "Update Provider Details" process to change the provider's Specialty

AND the provider is associated with a Delegated DSO

WHEN I select "Specialty"

THEN...
 # I see that the following actions occur:
 ## The Case Owner is updated to my name. 
 ## The Case Status is updated to "Closed."
 ## The Decision field on the case is updated to "Approved."
 ## The selected Business License, new specialty, and (if relevant) Board Certification details are captured on the case. 
 ## (If relevant) a Board Certification record is created.

column1: Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Acknowledgement - NM
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want the Recredentialing Acknowledgement letter to be automatically sent to providers based in New Mexico when their application is received, so the provider is aware that their app is being processed.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add a configuration record in Settings Manager for RECREDRECVDLTR if it does not already exists
2. SmartComm Template ID: RECREDRECVDLTR
3. You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Recredentialing Acknowledgement Letter|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Recredentialing%20Acknowledgement%20Letter?csf=1&web=1&e=ZLLvhh]

4. Mapping Sheet :  [https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAF1315C5-F2E5-4AC3-97F5-46AD3B1410CC%7D&file=Docgen%20Template%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&DefaultItemOpen=1]
5. Trigger this letter generation when for Recred case moved to In Progress
 - Recordtype = Recredentialing
 - BusinessLicense_{_}r.State{_}_c = NM 
 - Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "In Progress"
6. Validate the generated document is correct with the entire content including dynamic data 
7. Validate the document is accessible as per AC

6. On the resulting Identifier record, utilize the following:
 * Category = Add Other
 * Document Type = Misc App Processing Letter

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

column103:

*Scenario 2: Recred Acknowledgement is accessible to all users*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

{color:#172b4d}AND the provider is associated with a Standard Office practice{color}

{color:#172b4d}WHEN I update the case status to "In Progress"{color}

THEN...
 # I see that the Recredentialing Acknowledgement letter is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.

*Scenario #1: Provider is not being recredentialed in Louisiana*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND the state associated with the recredentialing application is +{color:#de350b}NOT{color}+ Louisiana 

WHEN I am viewing an open Recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see a button named "Recred App."
 # I see that when I click the button, the recredentialing application process is launched with the following steps:
 ## General Infor{-}mation{-}
 ## Professional Questions
 ## Attachments
 # I see that data that is already stored in Salesforce about the provider (i.e. First Name, Date of Birth, Personal Phone) is prefilled.
 # I see that on the Professional Questions step, I am prompted to reply "Yes" or "No."
 # I do +not+ see the "Please explain" comment box when I select "Yes" or "No." 

 

*Scenario #2: Provider is being recredentialed in Louisiana*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND the state associated with the recredentialing application is Louisiana 

WHEN I am viewing an open Recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see a button named "Recred App."
 # I see that when I click the button, the recredentialing application process is launched with the following steps:
 ## General Info{-}rmation{-}
 ## Professional Questions
 ## Attachments
 # I see that data that is already stored in Salesforce about the provider (i.e. First Name, Date of Birth, Personal Phone) is prefilled.
 # I see that on the Professional Questions step, I am prompted to reply "Yes," "No," or "N/A."
 # I do +not+ see the "Please explain" comment box when I select "Yes," "No," or "N/A."

column1: TIN Change Instructions - Phase 4
column31:
As a network support user I need to send instructions for Provider Changes, TIN Changes and Specialty changes so that I can support providers who wish to make these changes.

Solution Overview:

*TIN Change*

From the case interaction component when subreason = TIN Change

State picklist should show phase 2 states plus the following states for phase 4:
 
we need to send an attachment (state and network specific - [Tax ID Change Applications|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Tax%20ID%20Change%20Applications?csf=1&web=1&e=ZRwMZW]) Example: Network = DMX and state chosen = RI send DMX RI attachment along with updated email template. Each state will have 2 forms. 
 
 

Test Emails to be used in lower environments:

[test_customerservices@dentemax.com|mailto:test_customerservices@dentemax.com]

[test_providersupport@dnoa.com|mailto:test_providersupport@dnoa.com]

[test_dmxdatainquiry@dentemax.com|mailto:test_dmxdatainquiry@dentemax.com]

[test_dnoadentalproviderfees@dnoa.com|mailto:test_dnoadentalproviderfees@dnoa.com]

[test_enrollment@dentemax.com|mailto:test_enrollment@dentemax.com]

[test_dnoa_pa_notification@dnoa.com|mailto:test_dnoa_pa_notification@dnoa.com]

[test_noreply@dentemax.com|mailto:test_noreply@dentemax.com]

[test_noreply@dnoa.com|mailto:test_noreply@dnoa.com]

[test_noreply@bcbsil.com|mailto:test_noreply@bcbsil.com]

[test_noreply@bcbsmt.com|mailto:test_noreply@bcbsmt.com]

[test_noreply@bcbsnm.com|mailto:test_noreply@bcbsnm.com]

[test_noreply@bcbsok.com|mailto:test_noreply@bcbsok.com]

[test_noreply@bcbstx.com|mailto:test_noreply@bcbstx.com]

Notes:
 *  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

 Create the corresponding Salesforce Lightning Templates if they haven't been created yet. If they already exist, then update them accordingly. Need to have one template for each of the sub reasons, network and "entity" (organization or provider) combinations.
Example: "Info TIN Change - DMX - Provider"
Take into account that for the organization templates you need to user the Organization Contact field

Update the logic in Omniscript "PNM_SupportCaseCreation" so that the right templates are being used when the Reason is "Provide Instructions/Info" and the sub-reason are the ones described in the Solution Overview. For subreason = "TIN Change" also display an additional dropdown with the State options listed in the Solution overview.
Use the template named "Change Instructions Email.docx" for the sub-reasons TIN Change, Provider Changes, and Specialty.
For Voluntary Term Request use the template named "Provider Termination Request Email.docx"

NOTE: Make sure that the FROM email is the correct one as described in each of the templates.

Rename the attachments to make them unique as follows:
 * DNoA_Ownership-TaxIDChange_Generic_TN.pdf => TINCHANGEDNOATN.pdf

Upload the attachments into Files => Libraries => Document Templates

Create the following org wide email addresses (if it's not already created):
 * For dmxdatainquiry@dentemax.com:
 ** Display Name: DenteMax Provider Relations
 ** Email Address: [your dearborn's email address as of now]
 ** Purpose: User Selection
 ** Allow All Profiles to User this From Address
 * For dnoadentalproviderfees@dnoa.com:
 ** Display Name: DNoA Provider Relations
 ** Email Address: [your dearborn's email address as of now]
 ** Purpose: User Selection
 ** Allow All Profiles to User this From Address
 * For enrollment@dentemax.com:
 ** Display Name: DenteMax Provider Administration
 ** Email Address: [your dearborn's email address as of now]
 ** Purpose: User Selection
 ** Allow All Profiles to User this From Address
 * For dnoa_pa_notification@dnoa.com:
 ** Display Name: DNoA Provider Administration
 ** Email Address: [your dearborn's email address as of now]
 ** Purpose: User Selection
 ** Allow All Profiles to User this From Address

Make sure to validate those OWEA.

Update the logic in the corresponding OS so that you populate the FROM addresses based on the organization wide email addresses created above. This means that you will need to retrieve those email addresses querying the OrgWideEmailAddress object, and then those are assigned to the Email Action FROM field with a merge field (e.g: %OrgEmail:Address%)

Update the logic so that when is subreason = TIN the corresponding attachment is included (based on network and state). Use also a merge field on the Email Action Attachment List property

*Testing Notes:*

No testing needed
 

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

 

Notes:

When: I need to send TIN change instructions

Then: I can choose the correct state and send the instructions with the correct form

column1: Comms - Email - Complete Recredentialing Application Received
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want to send a confirmation email labeled "Complete Recredentialing Application Received" to providers upon successful submission of their recredentialing application.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 3/25/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing"
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain 

 * 
 **  

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes:*
 * You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Email_Recred App Complete|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recred%20App%20Complete?csf=1&web=1&e=sRjXZL]

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer SFDC-43782 for similar implementation
Refer SFDC-42804, same requirement for Letter
 * You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Email_Recred App Complete|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recred%20App%20Complete?csf=1&web=1&e=sRjXZL]
 * The following fonts should be utilized in the email body:
 ** DMX: Century Gothic
 ** DNOA/Blues: Ariel

1. If these are not configured before, then configure 2 records via Setup -> Organization-Wide Email Addresses
Note: use the test email ids for lower environments, and add a PD step to update the emails for PROD deployment
For DNOA/BCBS
Display Name: DNOACredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dnoa.com
Allowed Profiles: All
For DMX
Display Name: DMXCredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dentemax.com
Allowed Profiles: All

2. Add 2 or 7 new Lightning Email templates (For DNOA/Blues, if we can handle logo's dynamic then 1 template, otherwise 6 templates)
DNOA-Blues Recredentialing App Complete Email Template
DMX Recredentialing App Complete Email Template

If we cannot control the logo dynamic for DNOA/BCBSxx, then these are the names for DNOA & Blues
DNOA Recredentialing App Complete Email Template
BSBCIL Recredentialing App Complete Email Template
BSBCNM Recredentialing App Complete Email Template
BSBCTX Recredentialing App Complete Email Template
BSBCMT Recredentialing App Complete Email Template
BSBCOK Recredentialing App Complete Email Template

3. Base object for both these templates is Case

4. Use the content/logo for the template from the above "[Email_Recred App Complete|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recred%20App%20Complete?csf=1&web=1&e=sRjXZL]"

5. Use the existing Flow of the actual Email Action that accepts Template Id/Name, Network, any other inputs needed for the Flow
Use this query to fetch the From Email Id based on Input, e.g.
SELECT Id, Address, DisplayName FROM OrgWideEmailAddress WHERE DisplayName='DNOARecredentialing'

6. Use existing Flow as sub flow with in Recredentialing Case flow and based on the business criteria, call this new Flow
Criteria:
 - Recordtype = Recredentialing
 - Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Ready for CVO"

7. Validate the emails are working properly based on Network and Types

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column93: 20/Mar/24 12:24 PM;U512507;RE For Review Network Operations Stories (Sprint 6) .msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1484185/RE+For+Review+Network+Operations+Stories+%28Sprint+6%29+.msg
column103:
GIVEN that I am a Provider (aka a portal user) 

AND I am completing my recredentialing application

WHEN I navigate to the General Info{-}rmation{-} Step

THEN...
 # I see a "Recredentialing Application Details" section at the top of the screen with the following details that are read-only:
 ## State associated with the application
 ## My specialty associated with the state
 ## My primary practice associated with the state and network
 # I see a "General Information" section in the middle of the screen with the following details that are {color:#de350b}read-only and prefilled with my existing information{color}:
 ## First Name
 ## Last Name
 ## Middle Name
 ## Suffix
 ## Date of Birth
 ## Individual NPI (Type 1) 
 # I see a "Contact Information" section in the middle of the screen with the following details that are editable:
 ## Personal Phone
 ## Personal Email
 # I see an "Information{-}al{-} Subject to Change" section at the bottom of the screen with the following yes/no questions:
 ## Since your last credentialing date, have you become board certified or renewed certification?
 ## Since your last credentialing date, have you added or changed hospital affiliations?
 # I see that if I respond "yes" to one or both of the questions noted above, I am prompted to edit the following fields:
 ## Board Name
 ## Hospital Affiliation: Institution Name
 ## Hospital Affiliation: State

column1: RecredAppOS - UI - Allow user to enter supporting details on "Professional Questions" step
column31:
As a Provider, I want to be able to enter comments/details when I respond "Yes" to any of the questions on the Professional Questions step in my recredentialing app, so that I can provide the necessary information to support my response.

{color:#de350b}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes*
 #  

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 3/18/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing"
 ** Kritika Sharma (first 30 min)
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain RE: [3 of 5] For Review: Allow provider to enter supporting details on Professional Questions step

 * 
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis 3/19/24

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

 

*Mock-Up:*

For reference only! This should not be leveraged as testing AC.

!ProfessionalQuestionsRecredMock.PNG!

*{color:#0747a6}____________________________________________________________{color}*

*Technical Notes:*

Refer SFDC-39713 as similar Step is built 
1. Use OS PNM/ProviderReCredentialingApplication, and build the UI as per AC (refer SFDC-39713 to reuse the Professional Questions Step)
2. Make necessary changes to Professional Questions step, for each question when "Yes" is selected a new Comments box below the question to be displayed and a mandatory response is needed
3. Entered comments needs to be saved against the same question below the the question response in the JSON field
4. Validate the UI is working as expected in displaying the comments box when "Yes" is selected and save comments properly. Also validate the entered comments are re-displayed again on UI in the Professional Step
