column1: Recred - Fields - Manage recredentialing cycle dates by provider
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want to track key recredentialing dates related to each provider, so that important deadlines and milestones can be managed effectively. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 5
 * SFDC QA: 3

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 3/18/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing"
 ** Kritika Sharma (first 30 min)
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain "For Review: Managing recredentialing cycle dates by provider" 

 * 
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis 3/19/24

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes:*
 # The AC references "Provider Date" records, but the actual name of the object utilized is "Provider Date Config." This is expected/acceptable for the functional AC. 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Create a new custom object "Provider Date Config"  (ProviderDateConfig__c) with the following fields:
 - Provider (Provider__c Lookup to Person Account Record Id)
 - State Code (StateCode__c Picklist)
 - Network (Network__c Lookup to Payer Account) 
 - ReCred Due Date (ReCredDueDate__c Date)
 - Active (Active__c checkbox)

 

2. Add new configuration record for "Recred Due Date" to Effective Date rules metadata similar to "Appeal Window End Date"
 - Type = Recred Due Date
 - Output Add Days = 1065
 - all other values same as "Appeal Window End Date"

 

3. Credential Application: Per AC #1 or AC #2, when application is approved, look for an entry in ProviderDateConfig__c object for the same Provider, same State, same Network
If does not exists, create a record in ProviderDateConfig__c object
 - Provider__c = Provider Person Account Id
 - StateCode__c = same State as the application is for
 - Network__c = AccountId of the Payer Account) 
 - ** ReCredDueDate__c = Approval date (current date) + 1065 days (based on configuration from point #2 above, do not hardcode)
 - Active = true
Note: 
i. For States other than KY/NM, if there is already any record exists for the same Provider in ProviderDateConfig_{_}c object, use the same date for ReCredDueDate{_}_c field (DO NOT DETERMINE BASED ON CONFIGURATION)
ii. For States KY/NM, calculate the date always
iii. Need to configure this logic instead of hardcode, so that we should be able to adjust(add/remove) State based on business requirements.
If exists, no action

 

4. ReCredential Application: Per AC #3, when a recred app is approved, update ProviderDateConfig_{_}c.ReCredDueDate{_}_c field for the same Provider, same State, same Network
Note: 
i. For States other than KY/NM, update all records for the same Provider in ProviderDateConfig__c object with the new date as per configuration
ii. For States KY/NM, it will be a separate 1 record itself (update this particular record only)
iii. Need to configure this logic instead of hardcode, so that we should be able to adjust(add/remove) State based on business requirements.

 

5. Component named "Recredentialing Cycle", to show only records that are Active (true)

 

6. Validate implementation works as per requirement

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column103:
*Scenario #1: Provider's recredentialing dates are visible on the Provider 360*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist 

WHEN I view a Provider's account 

THEN...
 # To the right of the "Documents" subtab, I see a subtab named Related.
 # On the subtab, I see a component named "Recredentialing Cycle" with the following fields:
 ## State
 ## Network
 ## Recred Due Date
 ## Active

 

*Scenario #2: Provider completes credentialing for the first time in network*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist 

AND I am viewing an Application case that is associated with a new dentist (i.e. +New+ Dentist/New Location, +New+ Dentist/Existing Location) 

AND a Dental Director recently approved the Provider to join the network

WHEN I navigate to the Provider's account and view the "Recredentialing Cycle" component on the "Related" subtab

THEN...
 # I see that the provider's Recredentialing Due Date is displayed on all newly activated Provider Date records. 
 # If there are no existing Provider Date records, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date on the new Provider Date records is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days).
 # If the new Provider Date records are associated with KY or NM, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days)

 

*Scenario #3: Provider is credentialed in a new state*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Application case that is associated with an existing dentist joining the network in a new state — {+}Existing Dentist{+}/New Location/{+}New State{+}

AND a Dental Director recently approved the Provider to join the network 

AND the provider was recently approved to be affiliated with the existing locations 

WHEN I navigate to the Provider's account and view the "Recredentialing Cycle" component on the "Related" subtab

THEN...
 # I see that the provider's Recredentialing Due Date is displayed on all newly activated Provider Date records. 
 # If the new Provider Date records are associated with KY or NM, then...
 ** I  see that the Recredentialing Due Date is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days).
 # If new Provider Date records are not associated with KY or NM, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date on the new Provider Date records is set to the same date value found on the existing records. 

 

*Scenario #4: Returning provider completes credentialing to rejoin the network*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist 

AND I am viewing an Application case that is associated with a dentist that was previously in network, but was terminated

AND the dentist has been terminated from the network for more than 30 days — meaning they missed their window to appeal

AND a Dental Director recently approved the Provider to rejoin the network

WHEN I navigate to the Provider's account and view the "Recredentialing Cycle" component on the "Related" subtab

THEN...
 # I see that the provider's Recredentialing Due Date is displayed on all newly activated Provider Date records. 
 # If there are no existing active Provider Date records, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date on the new Provider Date records is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days).
 # If the new Provider Date records are associated with KY or NM, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days)

 

*Scenario #5: Provider is recredentialed*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing a Recredentialing case

AND a Dental Director recently approved the Provider to remain in the network

WHEN I navigate to the Provider's account and view the "Recredentialing Cycle" component on the "Related" subtab

THEN...
 # If the provider's case was related to KY or NM, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is only updated on the Provider Date record related to the same state/network combination as the Recredentialing case.
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days). 
 # If the provider's case was {color:#de350b}not{color} related to KY or NM *AND* the provider {color:#de350b}+is not+ {color}+active+ in KY or NM, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is updated on all related Provider Date records.
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days).
 # If the provider's case was {color:#de350b}not{color} related to KY or NM *AND* the provider +{color:#de350b}is{color} active+ in KY or NM, then...
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is updated on all related Provider Date records except those associated with KY or NM.
 ** I see that the Recredentialing Due Date is set to 3 years in the future (Approval Date + 1065 days).

column1: Recred - Batch Job - Mass create on-cycle recredentialing cases
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want on-cycle recredentialing cases to be created automatically, so that the recredentialing process can be efficiently managed for multiple providers at once. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 3
 * SFDC QA: 2

 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 3/18/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing"
 ** Kritika Sharma (first 30 min)
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain RE: [2 of 5] For Review: Mass create on-cycle recredentialing cases
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis 3/19/24

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes:*
 # The AC references "Provider Date" records, but the actual name of the object utilized is "Provider Date Config." This is expected/acceptable for the functional AC. 
 # In addition to the Recredentialing case, Developer/Sys Admin users will also observe that a Group Recredentialing case is created as part of the processes noted in the AC. This is expected behavior, but references to the Group Recredentialing case are intentionally left out of the AC because that case record is only visible to Developers/Sys Admins. 
 # QA team members will need to update Provider Date Config records from the backend in order to test this story appropriately. 

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add new configuration record for "ReCred Case Creation" to Effective Date rules metadata similar to "Appeal Window End Date"
 - Type = ReCred Case Creation
 - Output Add Days = 91
 - all other values same as "Appeal Window End Date"

2. Create a new RecordType "Group Recredentialing" or refer SFDC-42969

3. Create a Scheduled Flow that runs each day (timing 2am CST) 
 - Fetch all ACTIVE records from ProviderDateConfig_{_}c object where Active = true AND the ReCredDueDate{_}_c = Current date + Fetch "ReCred Case Creation" days from configuration.

i. For each Provider, create "Group Recredentialing" case with the following values
RecordType = Group Recredentialing
AccountId = Provider Person Account Id
Type = On Cycle 
Status = New

ii. For each record of the Provider (combination of Provider, State, Network), create a Recredentialing Case and set the following fields
RecordType = Recredentialing
AccountId = Provider Person Account Id
Type = On Cycle 
Business License = Active license record associated with the same State
Network = same Network
Status = New
Owner = Credentialing Queue
Due Date = 3 months away from today (TODAY + 91 days) (use the same "ReCred Case Creation" days from configuration)
ParentId = Record Id of "Group Recredentialing" created above
IMP: refer SFDC-41041 to see any additional field that are important needs to be included as well

4. Validate the batch executes and creates Group Recredentialing & Recredentialing cases as per requirement

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario #1:* *Provider does not operate in KY or NM*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I view a Provider account

AND the provider does {color:#de350b}NOT {color}operate in Kentucky (KY) or New Mexico (NM)

AND I navigate to the "Related" subtab to view the "Recredentialing Cycle" component

WHEN I see that the provider has a Recredentialing Due Date exactly 3 months away from today (TODAY + 91 days)

THEN...
 # I see that a separate Recredentialing case is created for unique state and network combination that the provider is +active+ in. 
 ## Note: If provider is not currently active in a particular state/network, a case should not be created — even if a Provider Date record exists. 
 # I see that Recredentialing Cases are created with the following notable attributes:
 ** Type = On Cycle 
 ** Business License = Active license record associated with the same state as the Provider Date record
 ** Network(s) = Single network documented on the Provider Date record
 ** Status = New
 ** Owner = Credentialing Queue
 ** Due Date = 3 months away from today (TODAY + 91 days)

{color:#172b4d}_Example:_{color} _Dr. Smith has 3 Provider Date records — 1 is associated with the state of Tennessee and the DMX network, 1 is associated with the state of Tennessee and the DNOA network, and 1 is associated with the state of Alabama and the DMX network._  _In this scenario, 3 Recredentialing cases should be created — 2 associated with the state of Tennessee and 1 associated with the state of Alabama._

 

*Scenario #2:* *Provider operates in multiples states including KY or NM — Upcoming recred date is NOT associated with KY/NM*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I view a Provider account

AND the provider is active in multiple states

AND the provider operates in Kentucky (KY) and/or New Mexico (NM)

AND I navigate to the "Related" subtab to view the "Recredentialing Cycle" component

AND I see that the provider has a Recredentialing Due Date exactly 3 months away from today (TODAY + 91 days)

WHEN I see that the {color:#172b4d}Provider Date record with the due date 3 months away is NOT{color} associated Kentucky (KY) or New Mexico (NM) 

THEN...
 # I see that a separate Recredentialing case is created for unique state and network combination that the provider is +active+ in — excluding KY or NM. 
 ## Note: If provider is not currently active in a particular state/network, a case should not be created — even if a Provider Date record exists. 
 # I see that a Recredentialing Case is created with the following notable attributes:
 ** Type = On Cycle 
 ** Business License = Active license record associated with the same state as the Provider Date record
 ** Network(s) = Single network documented on the Provider Date record
 ** Status = New
 ** Owner = Credentialing Queue
 ** Due Date = 3 months away from today (TODAY + 91 days)

_***In the states of KY and NM, compliance rules dictate that a provider cannot be recredentialed more frequently that every 3 years._ 

_Example:_ _Dr. Smith has 3 Provider Date records — 1 is associated with the state of Tennessee and the DMX network, 1 is associated with the state of Tennessee and the DNOA network, and 1 is associated with the state of Kentucky and the DMX network._  _In this scenario, 2 Recredentialing cases should be created — 2 associated with the state of Tennessee. Cases should not be created associated with the state of Kentucky._ 

 

*Scenario #3:* *Provider operates in multiples states including KY or NM* *— Upcoming recred date is associated with KY/NM*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I view a Provider account

AND the provider is active in multiple states

AND the provider operates in Kentucky (KY) and/or New Mexico (NM)

AND I navigate to the "Related" subtab to view the "Recredentialing Cycle" component

AND I see that the provider has a Recredentialing Due Date exactly 3 months away from today (TODAY + 91 days)

WHEN I see that the Provider Date record with the due date 3 months away is associated Kentucky (KY) or New Mexico (NM) 

THEN...
 # I see that a Recredentialing case is created for the state and network combination that matches the observed Provider Date record.
 ## Note: If provider is not currently active in a particular state/network, a case should not be created — even if a Provider Date record exists. 
 # I see that a Recredentialing Case is created with the following notable attributes:
 ** Type = On Cycle 
 ** Business License = Active license record associated with the same state as the Provider Date record
 ** Network(s) = Single network documented on the Provider Date record
 ** Status = New
 ** Owner = Credentialing Queue
 ** Due Date = 3 months away from today (TODAY + 91 days)

_***In the states of KY and NM, compliance rules dictate that a provider cannot be recredentialed more frequently that every 3 years._ 

_Example:_ _Dr. Smith has 4 Provider Date records — 1 is associated with the state of Tennessee and the DMX network, 1 is associated with the state of Tennessee and the DNOA network, 1 is associated with the state of Kentucky and the DMX network, and 1 associated with the state of Kentucky and the DNOA network._  _The Recred Due Date for DMX in KY is 3 months from today, and the Recred Due Date for DNOA in KY is 1.5 years from today._ _In this scenario, 3 Recredentialing cases should be created —_ _1 associated with DMX in TN,_ _1 associated with DNOA in TN,_ _and 1 associated with DMX in KY._

column1: Comms - Email - Recredentialing Acknowledgement
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want the Recredentialing Acknowledgement email to be automatically sent to a provider when their application is received, so the provider is aware that their app is being processed.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes:*
 * You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Email_Recredentialing Acknowledgment|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recredentialing%20Acknowledgment?csf=1&web=1&e=UTEShc]

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer SFDC-43782 for similar implementation
Refer SFDC-42804, same requirement for Letter
 * You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Email_Recredentialing Acknowledgment|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recredentialing%20Acknowledgment?csf=1&web=1&e=UTEShc]
 * The following fonts should be utilized in the email body:
 ** DMX: Century Gothic
 ** DNOA/Blues: Ariel

1. If these are not configured before, then configure 2 records via Setup -> Organization-Wide Email Addresses
Note: use the test email ids for lower environments, and add a PD step to update the emails for PROD deployment
For DNOA/BCBS
Display Name: DNOACredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dnoa.com
Allowed Profiles: All
For DMX
Display Name: DMXCredentialing
Email Address: recredentialing@dentemax.com
Allowed Profiles: All

2. Add 2 or 7 new Lightning Email templates (For DNOA/Blues, if we can handle logo's dynamic then 1 template, otherwise 6 templates)
DNOA-Blues Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template
DMX Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template

If we cannot control the logo dynamic for DNOA/BCBSxx, then these are the names for DNOA & Blues
DNOA Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template
BSBCIL Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template
BSBCNM Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template
BSBCTX Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template
BSBCMT Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template
BSBCOK Recredentialing Acknowledgement Email Template

3. Base object for both these templates is Case

4. Use the content/logo for the template from the above "[Email_Recredentialing Acknowledgment|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Forms/Email%20Templates/Approved%20Email%20Templates/Email_Recredentialing%20Acknowledgment?csf=1&web=1&e=UTEShc]e"

5. Use the existing Flow of the actual Email Action that accepts Template Id/Name, Network, any other inputs needed for the Flow
Use this query to fetch the From Email Id based on Input, e.g.
SELECT Id, Address, DisplayName FROM OrgWideEmailAddress WHERE DisplayName='DNOARecredentialing'

6. Use existing Flow as sub flow with in Recredentialing Case flow and based on the business criteria, call this new Flow
Criteria:
 - Recordtype = Recredentialing
 - Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "In Progress"

7. Validate the emails are working properly based on Network and Types

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column1: Prompt users to indicate if they want to send communication to confirm Directory Validation changes
column31:
As a Provider Rep on the Directory Validation team, I want the ability to indicate if I want to see a confirmation letter when a change to provider, facility, or organization data is completed, so that we can provide the appropriate follow-up to the requester. 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 0.5

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Testing Notes:*

 

*Technical Notes:*

1. Create a new field on Case object
 - Mode of Confirmation Letter (ModeOfConfirmationLetter__c Picklist with these values Email;Mail;None)
2. Update the following Omniscripts to include the above question as per AC
 - UpdateProviderDetailsWorkflow
 - UpdateFacilityDetailsWorkflow
 - UpdateOrgDetailsWorkflow
3. Save the user selection in each process to the respective Case record on ModeOfConfirmationLetter__c field
4. Validate all changes are working as expected

 

*Mock-Up:*

{color:#de350b}Reference/replicate similar existing UI from Upload Supporting Documents OS related to Specialty Change cases. {color}

!ConfirmationLetter.PNG|width=824,height=299!

***Place the "Send notification letter once approved" prompt below the Upload Documents component and above the "I have received the required documentation to update this info" attestation question.

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column1: Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Involuntary Termination - NM
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I need the Involuntary Terminations Letter to be automatically sent to the provider when they are terminated via the recredentialing process, so that I do not need to manually generate and send the letter.

 

____________________________________________________________

*Testing Notes*
 # SmartComm Template: INVTERMLTR
 # You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Involuntary Termination (Non-Cred Term Version)|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Involuntary%20Termination%20(Non-Cred%20Term%20Version)?csf=1&web=1&e=Ip74AG]

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s):
 * Written Approval(s): RE: [7 of 8] For Review: Recred Involuntary Termination Email & Letter
 ** Monique Sanders-Ellis

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add a configuration record in Settings Manager for INVTERMLTR if it does not already exists
2. SmartComm Template ID: INVTERMLTR
3. You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: Involuntary Termination (Non-Cred Term Version)
4. Mapping Sheet :  [https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAF1315C5-F2E5-4AC3-97F5-46AD3B1410CC%7D&file=Docgen%20Template%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&DefaultItemOpen=1]
5. Trigger this letter generation when for Recredentialing case is terminated (use the Flow automation for Recredentialing Case type)
 - Recordtype = Recredentialing 
 - LicenseState__c = NM
 - Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
 - OGMDecision__c = "Terminated"
6. Validate the generated document is correct with the entire content including dynamic data and sent to mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility
7. Validate the document is accessible as per AC only to Devs, Admins, Dental Director and Credentialing Specialist only.

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*

column93: 28/May/24 11:41 AM;U532641;SFDC-41061 Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Involuntary Termination - NM.xlsx;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1553002/SFDC-41061+Comms+-+Letter+-+Recredentialing+Involuntary+Termination+-+NM.xlsx
column103:
*Scenario 1:* *New Mexico provider is terminated via recredentialing*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed an recredentialing case associated with the provider with the decision of "Terminated"

WHEN the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

THEN...
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility. 
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. name, termination date, termination reason).
 # I see that the Involuntary Termination Letter notes that the provider has 30 days to appeal the decision. 

 

*Scenario 2: Involuntary Termination Letter* *is not visible to most users*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

WHEN I see that the Dental Director recently closed an recredentialing case associated with the provider with the decision of "Terminated"

THEN...
 # I see that the  Involuntary Termination Letter is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be viewed/downloaded by the Dental Director and Credentialing Specialist only. 
 # I see that no other users in Salesforce have the ability to view and/or download the  Involuntary Termination Letter.

column1: Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Success - NM
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I need the Recred Success letter to be automatically sent to providers based in New Mexico when their recredentialing application is approved, so that I do not need to manually generate and send the letter.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 2

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add a configuration record in Settings Manager for RECREDSUCCESLTR if it does not already exists
2. SmartComm Template ID: RECREDSUCCESLTR
3. You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Recredentialing Success Letter|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Recredentialing%20Success%20Letter?csf=1&web=1&e=Pksdul]

4. Mapping Sheet :  https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAF1315C5-F2E5-4AC3-97F5-46AD3B1410CC%7D&file=Docgen%20Template%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&DefaultItemOpen=1

5. Trigger this letter generation when for Recred case when approved
- Recordtype = Recredentialing
- BusinessLicense__r.State__c = NM 
- Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
- OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
6. Validate the generated document is correct with the entire content including dynamic data 
7. Validate the document is accessible as per AC

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario 1: Provider's recredentialing application is approved*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing a recredentialing case

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

AND the provider is associated with a Standard Office practice

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Success letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the Recred Success letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility. 
 # I see that the Recred Success letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. name).

 

-*Scenario 2: Provider's recredentialing appeal is approved*-

-GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist-

-AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a recredentialing case-

-AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico-

-AND the provider is associated with a Standard Office practice-

-WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's appeal case-

-THEN...-
 # -I see that the Recred Success letter is automatically generated.-
 # -I see that the Recred Success letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility.- 
 # -I see that the Recred Success letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. name).-

 

*Scenario 3: Recred Success Letter is accessible to all users*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I am viewing a recredentialing case

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

AND the provider is associated with a Standard Office practice

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Success letter is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.

column1: Termination - Term Date Logic - Phase 4 States
column31:
As a Network Support or Retention user I need termination dates to contain logic in accordance with regulations so that I can enter conforming termination dates.

 

*Open Questions:*
 * When it is something different than the end of month (i.e: 30 days), is it x days from today, from the end of month, requested date or from another date?
 * Can the termination date be in the past?
 * Is it "at least x days"? or is exactly x days?
 * In the text most says "without a cause". Does it mean that if there are particular termination reasons that override that?
 * If a provider or practice works on more than 1 state, which one is considered?
 * Is "x days" = calendar days, business days, it depends?

 

*Solution Overview:*

In termination omniscript for Organization, Facility, and Provider make a new user input for "Notification Date"
 * Notification date is a date picker and value can be a past value
 * Notification date is required and is dependent on Termination Type and will only be displayed when Termination Type = Voluntary

After user enters Notification Date, the termination date is autofilled

User can change the autofilled value in Termination Date subject to requirements by state

*Standard Termination Date Logic*

*Voluntary Termination*

Termination date will be autofilled as the LAST DAY of the month closest to 90 calendar days out, but not to exceed 90 calendar days from date entered in Notification Date. 

Example: Notification Date is July 20th. Termination Date Autofill would be September 30th (72 calendar days).

*Involuntary Termination*

Do not display notification date when Termination Type = Involuntary

Autofill the Termination Date with the last day of the current month.

Example: User launches action on July 20th, termination date autofill would be July 31st.

*State Specific Logic (Voluntary Termination Only):*

Rhode Island:
 * If Organization, Facility, or Provider being terminated is in Rhode Island (RI) AND termination reason = 'Voluntary - Contractual' then termination date is 15 days after date entered in Notification Date field on omniscript
 * User cannot change the termination date to a date more than 15 calendar days from date in Notification Date field

Hawaii: 
 * User cannot change termination date to a date less than 60 calendar days from date in Notification Date field

North Dakota:
 * User cannot change termination date to a date less than 60 calendar days from date in Notification Date field

South Dakota:
 * User cannot change termination date to a date less than 60 calendar days from date in Notification Date field

Matrix with state requirements: 

[Provider-Termination-Provisions-7.27.2022.xlsx|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/06%20Execution%20Artifacts/Compliance/Provider-Termination-Provisions-7.27.2022.xlsx?d=w0091a7988e3148208784da11c0c62efb&csf=1&web=1&e=Ud93bL]

 

*Technical Notes:*

{color:#de350b}*[WIP]*{color}

 

Before creating any new integration procedure and / or data raptor, double check if there is an existing one already that meets the needed criteria.

 

 

*-----------------------------------* 

*Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 
 * SFDC QA: 

*----------------------------------*

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
Given: I am a Network Support or Retention user
When: I am entering a termination for a Practice, Provider, or Facility
Then: the termination date should prepopulate with a suggested date based on the most restrictive date that applies to a selection I have made

column1: Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage - NM
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want to send a notification to providers based in New Mexico about the approval of their recredentialing appeal, specifically for cases without a break in participation, through a "Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Participation Letter."

____________________________________________________________

*Testing Notes*
 # SmartComm Template: APPLNOBREAK
 # You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Appeal%20Approval%20-%20No%20Break%20in%20Coverage?csf=1&web=1&e=Pdr7Tg]

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer SFDC-38446 for Appeal Approval scenario and this is in extension to it.
1. Add a configuration record in Settings Manager for APPLNOBREAK if it does not already exists
2. SmartComm Template ID: APPLNOBREAK 
3. You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Appeal%20Approval%20-%20No%20Break%20in%20Coverage?csf=1&web=1&e=Pdr7Tg]

4. Mapping Sheet :  https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAF1315C5-F2E5-4AC3-97F5-46AD3B1410CC%7D&file=Docgen%20Template%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&DefaultItemOpen=1
5. Trigger this letter generation when appeal associated to a Recred is approved (use the Flow automation for Appeal Case type)
- Recordtype = Appeal (and its Parent Case's recordtype is Recredentialing)
- Type = Recredentialing
- BusinessLicense__r.State__c = NM 
- Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
- OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
- The corresponding HFN's Effective to is in FUTURE (IMP/CAUTION: make sure this process runs before clearing the Effective to date on HFNs)
6. Validate the generated document is correct with the entire content including dynamic data 
7. Validate the document is accessible as per AC

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column92: 27/May/24 11:30 PM;U532641;SFDC-39099 Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage - NM.xlsx;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1552098/SFDC-39099+Comms+-+Letter+-+Recredentialing+Appeal+Approval+-+No+Break+in+Coverage+-+NM.xlsx
column103:
{*}Scenario 1: P{*}{*}rovider was terminated and reinstated via recredentialing, but there was not a break in coverage - DMX{*}

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Re-credentialing case

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

AND I see that the Appeal case was approved BEFORE the Effective To date that was previously set on the related Healthcare Facility Network -Provider- record

WHEN the network associated with the affiliation is DMX

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility.
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. name, effective date).

 

{*}Scenario 2: P{*}{*}rovider was terminated and reinstated via recredentialing, but there was not a break in coverage - DNOA/BCBS{*}

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Re-credentialing case

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

WHEN the network associated with the affiliation is DNOA/BCBS

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility.
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. name, effective date).

 

*Scenario 3: Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage letter is accessible to all users*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Re-credentialing case

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

WHEN I see that the Appeal case was approved BEFORE the Effective To date that was previously set on the related Healthcare Provider record

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - No Break in Coverage Letter is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.

column1: Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage - NM
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I want to send a notification to providers based in New Mexico about the approval of their recredentialing appeal, specifically for cases with a break in participation, through a "Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Participation" letter.

____________________________________________________________

*Testing Notes*
 # SmartComm Template ID: APPLBREAKIN
 # You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Appeal Decision - Approval - Break in Coverage|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Appeal%20Decision%20-%20Approval%20-%20Break%20in%20Coverage?csf=1&web=1&e=6E8aeM]

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Refer SFDC-39099 for Appeal Approval scenario with No Break in.
1. Add a configuration record in Settings Manager for APPLBREAKIN if it does not already exists
2. SmartComm Template ID: APPLBREAKIN 
3. You can find example versions of the documents and the language in the body here: [Appeal Decision - Approval - Break in Coverage|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Appeal%20Decision%20-%20Approval%20-%20Break%20in%20Coverage?csf=1&web=1&e=6E8aeM]

4. Mapping Sheet :  https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAF1315C5-F2E5-4AC3-97F5-46AD3B1410CC%7D&file=Docgen%20Template%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&DefaultItemOpen=1
5. Trigger this letter generation when appeal associated to a Recred is approved (use the Flow automation for Appeal Case type)
- Recordtype = Appeal (and its Parent Case's recordtype is Recredentialing)
- Type = Recredentialing
- BusinessLicense__r.State__c = NM 
- Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
- OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
- The corresponding HFN's Effective to is in PAST (IMP/CAUTION: make sure this process runs before creating a new set of HFN's and refer the old set of records)
6. Validate the generated document is correct with the entire content including dynamic data 
7. Validate the document is accessible as per AC

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

column92: 27/May/24 11:34 PM;U532641;SFDC-39098 Comms - Letter - Recredentialing Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage - NM.xlsx;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1552200/SFDC-39098+Comms+-+Letter+-+Recredentialing+Appeal+Approval+-+Break+in+Coverage+-+NM.xlsx
column103:
{*}Scenario 1: P{*}{*}rovider was terminated and reinstated via recred process resulting in a break in coverage{*}

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Recredentialing case

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

AND I see that the Appeal case was approved AFTER the Effective To date that was previously set on the related Healthcare Facility Network -Provider- record

WHEN the network associated with the affiliation is DMX
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility.
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. name, effective date).

 

*Scenario 2: Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage letter is accessible to all users*

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND I am viewing an Appeal case associated with a Recredentialing case

AND I see that the Dental Director recently closed the Appeal case with the decision of "Approved"

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

WHEN I see that the Appeal case was approved AFTER the Effective To date that was previously set on the related Healthcare Provider record

THEN...
 # I see that the Recred Appeal Approval - Break in Coverage Letter is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.

column1: Comms - Letter - URAC Term - NM
column31:
As a Credentialing Specialist, I need the URAC letter to be automatically sent to providers based in New Mexico when their application is approved but the provider doesn't meet URAC compliance requirements, so that I do not need to manually generate and send the letter.

 

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 2
 * SFDC QA: 2

____________________________________________________________

*Business Stakeholder Approvals*
 * Verbal Approval(s): 3/25/24 "SF PNM: Recredentialing"
 ** Monique Sanders Ellis
 * Written Approval(s): Email chain 

 * 
 **  

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

1. Add a configuration record in Settings Manager for URACTERMLTR if it does not already exists
2. SmartComm Template ID: URACTERMLTR
3. You can find examples of the letters with the language in the body of the letter here: [Accreditation Compliant (URAC) Term Letter|https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/Shared%20Documents/02%20Planning%20Artifacts/Background%20Documentation/Correspondence%20Examples/Accreditation%20Compliant%20(URAC)%20Term%20Letter?csf=1&web=1&e=eOFqg5]

4. Mapping Sheet :  https://myfyi.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/teams/DNITPMO1/Projects/Provider%20Network%20Management/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BAF1315C5-F2E5-4AC3-97F5-46AD3B1410CC%7D&file=Docgen%20Template%20Mapping.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&DefaultItemOpen=1
5. Trigger this letter generation when for Recred case when approved 
- Recordtype = Recredentialing
- BusinessLicense__r.State__c = NM 
- Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
- OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
6. Trigger this letter generation when appeal associated to a Recred is approved (use the Flow automation for Appeal Case type)
- Recordtype = Appeal (and its Parent Case's recordtype is Recredentialing)
- Type = Recredentialing
- Network = DMX
- BusinessLicense__r.State__c = NM 
- Status IS CHANGING AND Status = "Closed"
- OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
7. Validate the generated document is correct with the entire content including dynamic data 
8. Validate the document is accessible as per AC

 

*Testing Notes:*
 #  

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column103:
*Scenario 1: Provider's recred case was approved*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing a Recredentialing case associated with DMX

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

AND the most recent URAC Healthcare Provider Participation record related to the provider is inactive — meaning that the CVO determined that the provider is NOT eligible for URAC accreditation

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's recredentialing case

THEN...
 # I see that the URAC Term letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the URAC Term letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility.
 # I see that the URAC Term letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. exclusion start date, reason).

 

*Scenario 2: Provider's appeal was approved*

GIVEN that I am a Credentialing Specialist

AND I am viewing an Appeal Case related to a Recredentialing case associated with DMX

AND the state associated with the recredentialing case is the state of New Mexico

AND the most recent URAC Healthcare Provider Participation record related to the provider is inactive — meaning that the CVO determined that the provider is NOT eligible for URAC accreditation

WHEN the Dental Director approved the provider's appeal case

THEN...
 # I see that the URAC Term letter is automatically generated.
 # I see that the URAC Term letter is automatically sent to the mailing address associated with the provider's primary facility.
 # I see that the URAC Term letter displays the appropriate dynamic detail for the provider (i.e. exclusion start date, reason).

 

*Scenario 3: URAC Acknowledgement Letter is accessible to all users* 

GIVEN that I am a System Admin or Developer

AND the CVO completed the process of verifying a provider

AND the most recent URAC Healthcare Provider Participation record related to the provider is inactive — meaning that the CVO determined that the provider is NOT eligible for URAC accreditation

AND the provider's application OR appeal was approved

THEN...
 # I see that the URAC Term Letter is linked to the Provider's account in Salesforce, and can be can be viewed/downloaded as needed by all Salesforce users.

column1: Case - Action - Mass update cases to "Approved"
column31:
As a Dental Director, I need the ability to mass update cases to "Approved," so that I can quickly and easily approve "clean" providers and focus my attention on those that require additional investigation.

____________________________________________________________

*SFDC Story Points:*
 * SFDC Dev: 1
 * SFDC QA: 1

{color:#0747a6}*____________________________________________________________*{color}

*Technical Notes:*

Note: The list views and "Mass Approve" button already impkemented earlier
1. Use the current FlexCard/Flow which displays the message 
2. Based on user action, for the selected cases update the following fields
 - Status = "Closed"
 - OGMDecision__c = "Approved"
 - OGMDecisionBy__c = "Dental Director"
3. Validate the functionality
Note: some of the rules that we check needs to be revisited to make sure it works as per the latest AC

 

*Testing Notes:*
 # "Mass Approve" button is seen on other list views too in addition to the one mentioned. A user will get the error message as mentioned if the required conditions are not satisfied.
 # "Click "Submit" to move \{# of selected cases} to Approved." has been slightly modified to read as: "Click "Submit" to move \{# of selected cases} selected case(s) to Approved."
 # From the page, I am able to select "Cancel" to exit the process and prevent the applications from being mass updated. - This has not been executed at present as this feature is not readily available in Flow & will require additional efforts – to be taken up later.

 

*Pre-Deployment Steps:*

 

*Component List:*

 

*Post-Deployment Steps:*
column93: 24/May/24 4:22 PM;U512507;RE 5 of 5 For Review Mass update cases to approved.msg;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1551414/RE+5+of+5+For+Review+Mass+update+cases+to+approved.msg
column94: 19/Jun/24 7:43 AM;U532642;SFDC-38075_Case - Action - Mass update cases to Approved_Screenshots.docx;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1571523/SFDC-38075_Case+-+Action+-+Mass+update+cases+to+Approved_Screenshots.docx
column95: 19/Jun/24 7:43 AM;U532642;SFDC-38075_Case - Action - Mass update cases to Approved_TC.xlsx;https://jira.fyiblue.com/secure/attachment/1571524/SFDC-38075_Case+-+Action+-+Mass+update+cases+to+Approved_TC.xlsx
column103:
*Scenario #1: Mass Approve Cases*

GIVEN that I am a Dental Director

WHEN I view any of the following Case list views:
 # Dental Director: Initial Apps - 0
 # Dental Director: Initial Apps - 1
 # Dental Director: OnCycle Recred - 0
 # Dental Director: OnCycle Recred - 1
 # Dental Director: OffCycle Recred - 0
 # Dental Director: OffCycle Recred - 1

WHEN I view Case list views

THEN…
 # I see a button named "Mass Approve."
 # I am able select specific and/or all cases via checkboxes.
 # After I select the cases I want to mass update and I click the "Mass Approve" button, I am presented with a new console tab that displays the following message:
 ## Click "Submit" to move \{# of selected cases} to Approved.
 # -From the page, I am able to select "Cancel" to exit the process and prevent the applications from being mass updated.-
 # From the page, I am able to select "Submit" which initiates the following automated actions:

 # 
 ## The selected case is updated to "Closed."
 ## The Dental Director field is updated to my name. 
 ## The Decision field on the case is updated to "Approved."
 ## The Decided By field on the case is updated to "Dental Director."

 

*Scenario #2: Attempt to utilize mass approval on cases that do not meet* *criteria*

GIVEN that I am a Dental Director

AND I navigate to the Cases tab

WHEN I launch the "Mass Approve" process
 # I see that I am only permitted to mass approve cases that meet the criteria below:
 ## Exception Category = (0 or 1)
 ## Is Closed = False
 # I see that if I attempt to mass approve cases that do not meet the criteria, I encounter the error noted below:
 ## Please review your selected case(s). Only open cases with an Exception Category score of 0-1 can be mass approved. 

 

*Scenario #3: Attempt to utilize mass approval as a non-Dental Director user*

GIVEN that I am NOT a Dental Director

AND I navigate to the Cases tab

WHEN I launch the "Mass Approve" process
 # I see that I encounter the error noted below:
 ## You are not permitted to use this action. Please close this tab.

column321:
06/May/24 2:05 PM;U512507;[~U512185] - SFDC-38075 is ready for review! This is a story that Amitabh began work on. Please note that the Dental Directors requested that we expand/adjust this functionality. I've noted the original AC that Amitabh implemented below for reference. From a high-level, this is what has changed:
 # The new list views are no longer needed because DDs want to be able to make the Approve/Term/Deny decision while the case is assigned to a queue. 
 # The "Mass Approve" functionality should be available on all list views with cases owned by the DD queue. 

 

*Scenario #1: Addition of new recred list views*

GIVEN that I am a Dental Director

WHEN I navigate to the Cases tab

THEN... 
 # I see a list view named "My Open Recred Cases: 0" that displays all open Application cases I own with a CVO Exception Category score of 0. I see the list view has the following columns:
 ## Case Number
 ## Subject
 ## Type
 ## Account
 ## Status
 ## CVO Exception Category
 ## Date/Time Opened
 # I see a list view named "My Open Recred Cases: 1" that displays all open Application cases I own with a CVO Exception Category score of 1. I see the list view has the following columns:
 ## Case Number
 ## Subject
 ## Type
 ## Account
 ## Status
 ## CVO Exception Category
 ## Date/Time Opened

 

*Scenario #2: Mass Approve Recredentialing Applications*

GIVEN that I am a Dental Director

AND I navigate to the Cases tab

WHEN I view the "My Open Recred Cases: 0" OR "My Open Recred Cases: 1" list view

THEN... 
 # I see a button named "Mass Approve."
 # I am able select specific and/or all cases via checkboxes. 
 # After I select the cases I want to mass update and I click the "Mass Approve" button, I am presented with a new console tab that displays the following message:
 ## Click "Submit" to move \{# of selected cases} to Approved. 
 # From the page, I am able to select "Cancel" to exit the process and prevent the applications from being mass updated. 
 # From the page, I am able to select "Submit" which initiates the following automated actions:
 ## The selected case is updated to "Closed."
 ## The Decision field on the case is updated to "Approved."
 ## The Decided By field on the case is updated to "Dental Director."

 

*Scenario #3: Attempt to utilize mass approval on cases that do not meet critiera*

GIVEN that I am a Dental Director

AND I navigate to the Cases tab

WHEN I launch the "Mass Approve" process
 # I see that I am only permitted to mass approve cases that meet the criteria below:
 ## Record Type = Recredentialing 
 ## Is Closed = False
 # I see that if I attempt to mass approve cases that do not meet the criteria, I encounter the error noted below:
 ## Please review your selected case(s). Only open recredentialing cases can be mass approved. 

 

*Scenario #4 Attempt to utilize mass approval as a non-Dental Director user*

GIVEN that I am NOT a Dental Director

AND I navigate to the Cases tab

WHEN I launch the "Mass Approve" process
 # I see that I encounter the error noted below:
 ## You are not permitted to use this action. Please close this tab. ;;;
